<summary>

* The invention relates to methods and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance matched to a subject's respiratory need.
* The invention is suitable for spontaneously breathing human subjects requiring long-term ventilatory assistance, particularly during sleep.
* The invention aims to meet three goals: closely matching the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts, automatically adjusting the degree of assistance to maintain at least a specified minimum ventilation, and working correctly in the presence of large leaks.
* Most simple home ventilators fail to meet the goal of adjusting the degree of assistance to maintain at least a given ventilation and closely matching the subject's respiratory phase.
* Proportional assist ventilation (PAV) tailors the pressure vs time profile within a breath to unload the subject's resistive and elastic work, but it has disadvantages such as overestimation of V(t) in the presence of leaks and reliance on the subject's chemoreceptor reflexes.
* The invention discloses a method for calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle as a continuous variable from 0 to 1 revolution.
* The method includes selecting at least two identifiable features of a prototype flow-vs-time waveform, determining the phase and assigning a weight to each feature, defining fuzzy sets for magnitude and rate of change, and setting fuzzy inference rules for each feature.
* The method measures leak-corrected respiratory airflow, calculates fuzzy membership in fuzzy sets, applies fuzzy inference rules to determine the fuzzy extent to which the phase is a particular feature, and applies a defuzzification procedure to determine the instantaneous phase.
* The invention also discloses methods for calculating the average respiratory rate and providing ventilatory assistance in a spontaneously breathing subject.
</summary>

• The invention describes an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for use in standard endoscopic procedures, with a distal, working tip electrode and a proximal end with an electric plug for connecting to a conventional electro-surgical unit.
• The instrument includes a rigid insulating sleeve surrounding a conductive rod that extends to the distal end, with a rigid arm extending from the sleeve and including portions laterally offset from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve. A working tip electrode is formed at the free end of the arm and comes in various shapes.
• The arm's lateral offset from the sleeve's axis provides maximum visualization of the working tip electrode and operation site by the surgeon.
• The instrument is useful in both endoscopic and open surgical procedures, and the design aims to reduce obstruction of the surgeon's view and prevent inadvertent cauterization of healthy tissue.

• The invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) apparatus with a magnet, patient receptacle, support plate, and transmit and/or receive coils for imaging in multiple exposure positions with adjustment parameters.
• In conventional MRI, adjustment parameters must be manually modified for different exposure positions, which can be time-consuming and hinder efficient imaging.
• The invention determines required adjustment parameters in a preceding adjustment process and stores them for use in a subsequent exposure process, reducing examination times and improving image quality.
• Adjustment parameters can be modified through spatial modification of the support plate or connection/disconnection of transmit and/or receive coils.
• The apparatus is suitable for various forms of MRI, including cylindrical and horseshoe magnets.
• The apparatus includes a support plate for examining larger body sections, making it ideal for tracking contrast agent doses over large body regions.
• During measurement preparation, adjustment parameters for each position of the support plate are stored in memory, allowing for quick and efficient imaging measurements without the need for new adjustments.
• The invention allows for high-contrast exposures and reduced examination times, even in examinations of larger body segments, and is adaptable to various MRI techniques and procedures.

• The invention describes a releasable fastener for albums with front and back covers and removable pages, using a pair of strap anchors, a strap, and means for providing a releasable connection between the strap and each of the strap anchors.
• Each strap anchor is in the form of a channel, and the strap is a snap lock that is releasably locked therein against displacement, preventing longitudinal movement within the channel when engaged.
• The strap enters into the channel via an aperture in the base of the channel, which is bordered by a projection adapted to extend into the adjacent hole in the cover to ensure correct location between the strap anchor and the cover.
• The album has at least two fasteners mounted along the spine part of the album, with the strap anchors of each fastener attached to the respective covers of the album.
• The strap anchors can be adhesively attached to the respective covers, for example by double-sided adhesive tape.
• The invention provides a more convenient and adjustable fastening system for adding or replacing album pages compared to the conventional screw-type fastening system.

• The invention describes a new sulky design that can be made of lightweight and durable materials, such as light metals and aluminum, and can be easily assembled from flat elements.
• The shafts of the sulky are fastened to the frame in the wheel planes, which allows for a casting process instead of welding, reducing weight and cost.
• The end frames are designed to be symmetrical and to have all wheel-fastening, shaft-fastening, and crossbar-fastening devices in the same vertical plane, ensuring a stable construction.
• The crossbar is adapted to the mounting bushings and can be fastened thereto, and the wheels and shafts can be adjusted in a longitudinal direction.
• The driver's seat is fastened to the crossbar by extruded brackets, which can be clamped thereto by conventional clamping devices.
• The complete sulky can be packed into a flat box for storing and transportation, and the end frames are identical during production and can be used on either side of the sulky.

<summary>

* The invention is a ventilation system for rotating water feeds, specifically for water-cooled generators with coaxial feed and discharge ducts.
* The system aims to remove or reduce air or gas bubbles that may accumulate in rotating pipes, which can cause overheating and inefficiency.
* The system includes at least one bypass with an inlet in the space around the axis of rotation and outlets between the feed duct and the discharge duct.
* The pressure gradient between the inflow and outflow of the bypass allows for automatic operation and rapid removal of bubbles.
* The bypass can be arranged in various ways, such as in the end face of the feed ducts or as a coiled pipe with an inlet opening into the space around the axis of rotation.
* The system can include means for increasing the hydrodynamic resistance of flow through the bypass, enabling a pressure drop over a short distance with low resistance to flow.
* The invention provides a simple and effective solution to the problem of air or gas bubble accumulation in rotating water feeds.
* The drawings illustrate various embodiments of the invention, and the text describes the advantages and specifics of each embodiment.

</summary>

1. The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle with a jacket unit and a retaining part.
2. The jacket unit is secured non-displaceably to the retaining part up to a limit value of force, and becomes displaceable if the limit value is exceeded.
3. The jacket unit is connected to the retaining part through an energy absorption connection and a break-away connection.
4. The energy absorption connection comprises at least one bending wire or strip that is deformed when the jacket unit is displaced.
5. The break-away connection is released when the limit value of force is exceeded.
6. The invention also relates to a method for producing such a steering column.
7. Adjustable steering columns are known in various embodiment forms, including those adjustable in length, height, or inclination direction.
8. In the event of a vehicle crash, it is conventional to realize the steering shaft and jacket unit in a section adjoining the steering wheel-side end as displaceable in the longitudinal direction with the absorption of energy.
9. The invention aims to decrease the force peak (=break-away peak) in the break-away connection, making it simple and cost-effective yet functionally advantageous.
10. This is achieved by exerting an elastic prestress onto the at least one bending wire or strip, which decreases the force required to release the break-away connection in the event of a crash.

<summary>
 
* The invention is a method for installing a curved window panel using a flat uncontoured glass panel.
* The flat glass panel is flexed to conform to the curvature of the window bay and held in place by a holding means, such as resilient clips and a reveal molding.
* After the glass panel is secured in place, a weather sealant and adhesive compound is applied in situ along the confronting edges of the window panel and allowed to cure, fixing the panel permanently in the window opening.
* The holding means, comprising of clips and a reveal molding, urges the glass panel into conforming engagement with the bay of the window opening.
* The flat uncontoured glass panel is less rigid and less brittle, making it safer in the event of a vehicular accident as it is less likely to shatter and more likely to absorb shock and strain.
* The cost of a comparably sized flat glass panel is at least one eighth to one tenth the cost of a pre-treated, pre-contoured glass, making the invention a cost-effective solution.
 
 </summary>

<summary>

- The invention describes a method and apparatus for removing oxygen from water, particularly for use in offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms. The apparatus includes a vessel divided into multiple gasification chambers, each with a vapor space and a mechanism for ingesting and mixing a second gas into the liquid for displacing at least a portion of the first gas to the vapor space. A vent in each chamber removes gas, and a liquid outlet is present in the outlet chamber.
- The method involves introducing a flow of liquid having a first gas mixed therewith into the vessel, where the first gas is displaced by a second gas introduced into the liquid in each gasification chamber, creating a turbulent area and forcing the first gas out of the liquid as bubbles to the upper portion of the vessel. The first gas is collected and removed through a tank breather.

</summary>

Note: The summary provided above is a brief and general description of the invention, and it is recommended to refer to the full text for more specific details and examples.

<summary>
	• The packaging machine comprises a shaft driven by a motor, which is connected to a frame and extends in the production direction of the machine. The shaft drives the tool members of various work stations through transfer mechanisms, synchronizing their movements mechanically and independently of electronic synchronization.
	• The transfer mechanism can be an arrangement of toggle levers or a cam mechanism, and can include a wear-reducing element to reduce wear on the mechanism and shaft. The shaft can rotate continuously or alternately in different directions.
	• Work stations can be arranged on different vertical levels, and a tool member on a work station can be adapted to be displaced in the production direction of the packaging machine for easy adaptation to varying conditions.
	</summary>

• The text describes a disposable finishing article, such as a grinding wheel, with a drive member assembly permanently affixed to it.
• The drive member assembly includes a backing flange with reinforcing ribs and a retaining nut that screws onto a power tool's spindle.
• A pressure cap is snapped onto the backing flange, which applies compressive forces to the grinding wheel when the nut is tightened onto the spindle.
• The pressure cap is held in place by a gripping rib that snaps over radially outwardly extending fingers on the backing flange.
• The compression forces help to secure the grinding wheel in place and prevent it from moving or disengaging from the spindle during use.
• The device does not require adhesives for construction and is lightweight, vibration-free, and less expensive than prior art throw-away articles.
• The drive member assembly can accommodate all currently known sizes of standard diameter depressed center grinding wheels, and meets all safety standards currently known and in existence.

1. The invention describes a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system with a housing block, motor, and housing with a covering hood.
2. The motor is secured to the housing block with a securing face and has a shaft trunnion, eccentric, and shaft that extend into the motor.
3. The eccentric is a cam element that determines a pivot axis for two piston pumps that are operative independently of one another.
4. The piston pumps are displaceable longitudinally by the eccentric to generate pressure.
5. A conduit extends downward from the eccentric chamber and opens to the atmosphere to prevent pressure fluid from entering the motor and impairing its operability.
6. Pressure fluid entrained by the piston pump drips into a covering hood and cannot be precluded from moistening electrically operative components.
7. The invention collects pressure fluid in a spring chamber, far from electrical components, and eliminates the need for permeable elements or check valves.
8. The housing block can be produced economically by dual utilization of conduit portions and can be immersed in salty water without the risk of damage.
9. The invention brings about a pressure equilibrium between the motor and a covering hood, which contains electrically operative components and protects them from the harmful effects of the environment.
10. The invention avoids the provision of a pressure equalization hose and seals off the pressure-equalizing conduit relative to the environment.

<summary>

- The invention relates to a power and free conveyor system with a power chain that engages trolleys to move them in predetermined paths.
- Carriers are moved by pushers on the chain, and each carrier has pusher dogs that can be lowered or raised to engage or disengage with the pushers.
- At transfer points, such as a switch to a different track, the carrier is stopped and a pusher dog is moved to engage with a pusher on the new track to move the carrier forward.
- The system includes various ways to control the movement of the pusher dogs, such as cut-away portions of the track and cam down openings, to ensure proper engagement and disengagement of the pushers and pusher dogs.
- The system can accommodate transfers over short and long distances by selectively controlling the movement of the pusher dogs.
- The system can also minimize the number of pushers on the conveyor chain by moving multiple pusher dogs simultaneously or sequentially to reduce costs and transfer time.
</summary>

• The invention describes a rail car center plate assembly bowl liner made of a special type of ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) that is self-lubricating and conductive, eliminating the need for additional grounding apparatus.
• The liner is designed to replace the conventional manganese steel liner, which requires frequent lubrication and can cause damage to the car if not lubricated.
• The liner is formed of a dry self-lubricating material and has a dished, bowl-like configuration with a floor or disc portion and an upstanding side wall.
• The liner is made from a high density polymer of UHMW-PE specially mixed with a conductive material such as 2% carbon black, which increases the conductivity of the liner.
• The carbon black particles are uniformly distributed in the UHMW-PE matrix, and as the matrix wears, new carbon black particulates are exposed, maintaining the self-lubricating properties of the liner.
• The liner is designed to fully fill the space between the truck bolster bowl and the body bolster center plate, precluding movement of the center plate relative to the bowl in the plane of the center plate assembly.
• The liner also provides mechanical and electrical conductivity improvements, and the UHMW-PE material resists distension or stretching, and any substantial compaction due to compression.
• The liner holds the components firmly spaced apart and against forces, especially impact forces, and the UHMW-PE material disperses loads and has beneficial self-lubricating properties.

• The invention describes a gate valve designed for controlling the bulk dispensing of viscous substances, such as sauces and salad dressings, especially in fast-food restaurants.
• The valve is a one-handed operation mechanism, which can be mounted on the spout of a bag or pouch and includes a tubular sleeve, a dispensing package, a guide, and a reciprocable gate.
• The gate can be reciprocated by engaging cooperating lugs with the fingers of one hand, allowing for variable flow or complete cut-off.
• The valve is curved complementally transversely, ensuring a tight seal when closed and no obstruction when opened.
• The valve can be readily disassembled for cleaning, preventing residue accumulation, and can function in inclined positions.
• The detailed description is accompanied by drawings and illustrations to provide a better understanding of the invention.

<summary>

* The document describes a vehicle rearview mirror system that can adapt to different protocols of a vehicle control output.
* The system includes a variable reflective element that changes its reflectance level in response to a drive signal, and a mirror control that determines the protocol of the vehicle control output.
* The mirror control can handle different types of vehicle control outputs, such as gear status information, engine information, alarm information, or door status information.
* The mirror control can determine the protocol of the output by monitoring its state and attempting to conclude whether the vehicle is in reverse gear or not, or whether the vehicle doors are closed or not.
* The mirror control can be a microcomputer with software that determines the protocol by software processing.
* The system can include light sensors that establish a value for the drive signal based on the light levels.
* The system can also control a lighting assembly associated with an interior or exterior rearview mirror assembly.
* The invention allows the same vehicular rearview mirror system to be used on cars with different output protocols, and can be implemented in software, reducing hardware expenses.
</summary>

<summary>

* The document describes an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles that includes an anti-dive device to reduce chassis vibration caused by repeated operation of the anti-lock control unit.
* The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel and can be achieved by tapping hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit or by sensing and applying the actual reaction to braking force of the front wheel.
* The system includes a hydraulic pump, a modulator, a pressure discharge valve, and an inertial sensor, all arranged in a casing and supported on the axle and front fork.
* The system is designed to improve braking efficiency and reduce chassis vibration, particularly in motorcycles with high centers of gravity and short wheel bases.
</summary>

The document describes an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles that includes an anti-dive device to reduce chassis vibration caused by repeated operation of the anti-lock control unit. The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel and can be achieved by tapping hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit or by sensing and applying the actual reaction to braking force of the front wheel. The system includes a hydraulic pump, a modulator, a pressure discharge valve, and an inertial sensor, all arranged in a casing and supported on the axle and front fork. The system is designed to improve braking efficiency and reduce chassis vibration, particularly in motorcycles with high centers of gravity and short wheel bases.

<summary>
 
*- The invention describes an improved partition system for dividing cargo spaces in transportation vehicles, such as trailers, into independently movable and temperature-controlled zones.
*- The system includes center partition panels, lateral panels, and horizontal panels that can be moved along rails using trolley assemblies.
*- The panels can be raised and secured to the ceiling when not in use, maximizing cargo space and reducing strain on the temperature control system.
*- The trolley assemblies can be replaced with any mechanism that permits rotational, slideable, or hinged movement between the rails and the bulkhead.
*- The rails can be replaced with other receiving members that cooperate with the selected mounting means, and can be mounted on the side walls or ceiling of the trailer.
*- The panels can be secured relative to one another with various means, such as straps, buckles, channels, grooves, flanges, polymeric seals, or locking pins.
*- The invention can be implemented in a wide variety of configurations, and various modifications can be made without departing from the spirit and scope of the invention.
 
 </summary>

<summary>

* The invention is a novel sanitizable rotary valve used in conjunction with liquid chromatographic columns and sanitary liquid handling systems to separate and/or purify biological macromolecules.
* The rotary valve has a unique feature of partial (sealed) separation of the rotor-stator faces to allow flushing across the process fluid-contacting surfaces, enabled by a diaphragm-like elastomeric seal.
* The valve is designed for sanitizing in place (SIP) without disassembling the valve, and has a thermoplastic elastomeric diaphragm integrally molded to form the multiple sealing ports of the rotor face.
* The diaphragm has ports or grooves positioned to sealably engage grooves or ports in the stator face, and to form sanitary elastomeric tubular ducts leading through the body of the rotor, terminating as elastomeric flanges.
* The external limit of the elastomeric rotor diaphragm is molded to form a flexible wiping lip seal which maintains fluid-tight sealing engagement with the face of the stator even when the rotor is moved orthogonally away from the stator far enough to permit cross flushing of the port sealing faces.
* The invention also includes an insert molding process for forming in place a rotary valve diaphragm seal, and aims to provide a sanitizable slider valve in which the port-sealing faces of the slider and stator may be intermittently flushed and cleaned, while maintaining the sterile condition of the process system.
</summary>

• The text describes an improved valve-tray assembly for gas-liquid contacting trays, which incorporates directional thrust valves and tray construction for higher efficiency operation. The invention aims to address the problem of restricted disengagement of vapor retained in the liquid.

• The text also discusses the history of prior art in gas-liquid contact columns, including the use of trays, packing, and combinations thereof. It highlights the importance of intimate contact between liquid and vapor phases for successful fractionation and the trade-offs between pressure drop, liquid hold-up, and energy efficiency in different types of contact devices.

<summary>

- The fluid pressure regulator assembly (10) of the present invention is designed to generate power while regulating fluid pressure, and is particularly useful in applications such as gas grills, scuba diving equipment, and medical devices.
* The assembly comprises a pressurized fluid source (12), a vane motor (16) that converts fluid pressure into mechanical motion, a fluid regulator (20) that regulates fluid pressure, and a generator (30) that converts the mechanical motion of the vane motor into electrical energy.
* The vane motor (16) is constructed with a first vane assembly (82) and a second vane assembly (92), each with two vanes that are perpendicular to each other. The vanes are positioned within an inner drum (66) and an outer race (64), and are designed to reduce drag coefficient and increase efficiency as they rotate.
* The fluid regulator (20) is designed to regulate fluid pressure by using a diaphragm (46) and a valve stem (40) that responds to changes in fluid pressure.
* The generator (30) is coupled to the drive shaft (52) of the vane motor (16), and is designed to convert the mechanical motion of the vane motor into electrical energy that can be stored in a battery (32) or used directly for mechanical power.
</summary>

<summary>
- The invention describes a pallet system with a pallet base and a pallet cap that has guide rails for loading trays.
- The guide rails help to position and interlock the trays, restricting lateral and longitudinal movement of items on the pallet.
- End plates provide stability and protection to the load of trays and can be shaped to complement the contour of the trays.
- The pallet system can be customized for its intended load, with features such as slanted edges on guide rails, shaped end plates, and nesting capabilities.
- The components of the pallet system can be made of various materials and manufactured by different methods.
- Other embodiments of the invention include variations in the sizes, positions, and shapes of the components.
</summary>

<summary>
 
* The invention describes an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, which includes a saucer shell, a saucer cabin, a rotary-wing system, and a control system. 
* The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system, which comprises magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail. 
* The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended in the space restricted by the electromotive ring, the magnetic suspension shaft, and the magnetic suspension guide rail and go around the magnetic suspension shaft under an electromagnetic thrust.
* The invention also describes two improvement solutions for overcoming the problem of reactive torque of the rotary wing, which can realize stable and easy power control of the rotary wing.
* The design of the rotary-wing suspension structure avoids the contact and friction between the high-speed rotary-wing and the interior of the saucer shell, reduces the noise of the rotary wing during high-speed rotation as well as the vibration of the saucer shell and the saucer cabin, raises motive power conversion efficiency, lowers energy consumption, and guarantees the operational safety of the rotary wing and the flying saucer.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to streptavidin muteins, a process for their production using recombinant DNA technology, and their use for isolating, purifying, and determining biological substances.
* The biotin/streptavidin system is widely used in molecular biology, but its application can be limited as biotinylation is not always possible or simple, especially for recombinant proteins not yet isolated.
* Peptide ligands with specific binding affinity for streptavidin have been developed as an alternative, allowing for co-expression and fusion to the desired protein. This results in a recombinant protein labeled with the peptide ligand, which can be used without the need for cleavage.
* The streptavidin peptide ligand system offers advantages such as enabling purification under mild elution conditions and detection by Western blot, ELISA, or immune microscopy using streptavidin conjugates.
* The initial system had a relatively low affinity, but the invention aims to optimize this by modifying the peptide sequence or streptavidin.
* The invention also covers the use of streptavidin muteins in detection methods, a nucleic acid sequence coding for streptavidin, a vector containing the nucleic acid, a cell transformed with the vector, a process for producing a streptavidin mutein, and a reagent kit containing a streptavidin mutein.
</summary>

<summary>

- The invention describes methods for forming substituted guanidines utilizing nickel catalysts, specifically guanylating amines or pyrrolidines with guanylating agents such as thioureas or isothioureas.
- The nickel catalyst is preferably in the zero oxidation state, derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina.
- Guanidines are important in drug development, and the invention aims to provide high yield synthesis methods using minimal amounts of reagents and non-toxic catalysts.
- Commonly used guanylating agents include derivatives of pyrazole-1-carboxamidine, aminoiminomethanesulfonic acid, S-methylisothiouronium salts, S-alkylisothioureas, and protected thiourea derivatives.
- Thioureas and isothioureas are widely employed in the preparation of substituted guanidines, but existing methods require large quantities of coupling reagents and bases, and toxic mercuric salts.
- The invention's methods involve reacting guanylating agents with amines in the presence of a nickel catalyst, with the nickel catalyst present at less than 10 molar % based on the total moles of guanylating agent(s).
- Preferred guanylating agents are thioureas and isothioureas, with at least one of the R1-R4 groups being a protecting group, such as Boc groups, Cbz groups, or arylsulfonyl groups.
</summary>

• The invention describes an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytically coloring aluminum strips or wires, which overcomes the limitations of previous methods by providing aluminum articles with excellent weatherability and fade resistance.
• The apparatus includes an anodic oxidation bath for forming an oxide film on the aluminum surface, and an electrolytic coloring bath for coloring the anodized article. The aluminum strip or wire functions as an anode in the anodic oxidation bath and as a cathode in the electrolytic coloring bath without being connected directly to a power source.
• The anodic oxidation bath composition contains an aqueous solution of sulfuric acid, with optional additives, and forms an oxide film thicker than 4 microns on the aluminum surface. The electrolytic coloring bath contains at least one of nickel, cobalt, copper, tin salts, or selenious acid, and its composition and electrolytic conditions determine the final color of the aluminum article.
• The method involves a degreasing and etching process before the anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring steps. The apparatus also includes a current supply bath, wash baths, drive rollers, and guide rollers to ensure smooth passage of the aluminum strip or wire through each stage.
• The invention provides an energy-efficient, continuous process for coloring aluminum strips or wires, resulting in products with enhanced weatherability and fade resistance, making it suitable for various industrial applications.

<summary>

* The invention describes a process for rapid and inexpensive in planta assembly of a DNA sequence of interest designed for stable integration into a plant chromosome.
* The process allows for optimization of sequences to be expressed, screening of libraries of coding or regulatory sequences of interest, design of safer vectors, and linking of complex DNA fragments for stable nuclear transformation.
* The assembly of a DNA sequence of interest can be performed in planta using site-specific DNA recombination and various recombinases/integrases.
* The choice of a suitable promoter to drive expression of the recombinase affects the performance of the process, and different promoters perform better in different plant species.
* The transformed cells can be regenerated to whole plants using standard techniques, and transgenic seeds can be obtained from transgenic flowering plants.

</summary>

The present invention describes a process for rapid and inexpensive in planta assembly of a DNA sequence of interest designed for stable integration into a plant chromosome. This approach allows for fast optimization of the sequences to be expressed by testing various transcription, translation assembled units, units with different protein fusions or different protein targeting or post-translational modification, etc. It can be efficiently used for screening libraries of coding or regulatory sequences of interest. Another application of the invention is the design of safer vectors which are unable to transfer the sequence of interest through an illicit gene transfer. Also, difficult cloning can be avoided during the design of complex DNA regions (e.g. showing instability during cloning procedures in bacterial cells) for stable nuclear transformation, as two or more complex DNA fragments can be linked together in planta prior to integration into plant nuclear DNA.

The general scheme of such assembly from two or more (precursor) vectors by site-specific DNA recombination is shown in FIG. 1. The simplest scheme of such assembly is the creation of a DNA sequence of interest ab from two precursors vectors A and B by recombination using the recombination site RS (FIG. 1A, I). Needless to say that such recombination event shall be selectable. This is easy to achieve e.g. if said recombination creates a functional gene providing for selection.

• The invention describes a swash plate type compressor with a coated swash plate made from non-hypereutectic aluminum or aluminum alloys having less than 10% by weight of silicon, and a coating applied through a liquid spray process.
• The coating comprises a polyfluoro elastomer, a lubricious additive, and a load bearing additive, and is bonded directly to the aluminum swash plate. The coating provides a low coefficient of friction and high durability, and may eliminate one or more machining steps in the manufacturing process.
• The coating is cured in an oven at an elevated temperature, and the swash plate may have a roughened surface to aid in the mechanical attachment of the coating.
• The coated swash plate exhibits superior seizure loads and friction coefficient compared to uncoated or tin-coated swash plates, and performs equal to or better than hypereutectic aluminum swash plates. The coating does not require high surface finish or metal plating, and can be used on various types of swash plate materials.

• The present invention provides novel chemical compounds and preparation methods for use in anti-reflective coatings in photolithography processes for forming submicro-patterns using 193 nm (ArF) and 248 nm (KrF) light beams in the manufacture of semiconductor devices.
• The polymers of the present invention are designed to facilitate light absorption at specific wavelengths to prevent the standing wave effect and light reflection in lithography processes, and to eliminate rear diffraction and reflected light from lower layers. These polymers can be prepared by reacting polyhydroxystyrene resin, diazonaphthoquinone halide, and an amine in a solvent. The amine used is preferably trialkylamine, and more preferably triethylamine. The solvent used may be selected from tetrahydrofuran, toluene, benzene, methylethylketone, and dioxane. The reaction temperature is preferably between 50 and 80°C.

<summary>

* The invention describes a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic with a thickness of 10-350 μm.
* The film comprises at least one white pigment, one flame retardant, and one UV absorber, and has good orientability and thermoformability, and very good optical and mechanical properties.
* The invention also relates to the use of this film and to a process for its production.
* The film can be produced cost-effectively and has improved UV resistance compared to prior art films.
* The film complies with fire test standards DIN 4102 Part 2 and Part 1, and UL 94, and has high UV resistance, meaning it absorbs UV light and does not transmit light until the visible region has been reached.
* The film is thermoformable, meaning it can be formed into complex and large-surface-area moldings on commercially available thermoforming machinery without predrying.
</summary>

1. The present invention provides an improved method for producing 1,1,1-trifluoroethane (143a) by continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b) using heterogeneous catalysis.
2. The new process offers a simple, convenient, and economical industrial solution for manufacturing 143a with high conversion and selectivity rates (both over 99%).
3. The catalysts used in the process are a combination of iron oxide, rare earth oxide, and zirconium oxide, or a chromium (III) chloride supported on alumina.
4. The process operates at a temperature between 100° and 325° C, and a pressure between 1 atmosphere (0 psig) and 200 psig. The molar ratio of HF:142b can vary between greater than 1:1 and 20:1.
5. The invention avoids the formation of olefinic byproducts and offers a regeneration process for the catalyst, which is claimed in related U.S. Pat. No. 3,965,038.

• The invention describes an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound using hypophosphorous acid to improve product yield and reduce impurities.
• Pyrazolotriazoles, useful for photographic products, are difficult to synthesize, with few known synthetic routes. One preferred route involves preparation of triazolothiadiazines and subsequent desulfurization to form pyrazolotriazoles.
• The desulfurization process involves two steps: a ring contraction reaction in acetic anhydride, followed by hydrolysis and desulfurization with hydrochloric acid, which generates elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities.
• The sulfur-containing organic impurities can interfere with subsequent reactions and may cause fogging in photographic systems.
• The new process uses hypophosphorous acid in the deacylation and desulfurization step, reducing the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid results in the formation of hydrogen sulfide, which is readily removed from the reaction zone, and does not reduce nitro groups or affect other functional groups.
• The process is applicable to the preparation of a 3,6-disubstituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole having the formula: ##STR7##
• The substituents (R, R', and R") must be inert and stable under process conditions, non-reactive toward other reagents, and not prevent the formation of the desired compound.
• The invention is not limited to specific types of substituents, as long as they meet the criteria of being inert, and can include hydrocarbyl groups, alkoxy, aryloxy, nitro, and other groups.

• The invention describes a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types by taking partial quantities from fiber bales.
• The prior art method has several disadvantages, such as fluctuating dimensions, compressions, and weights of individual fiber bales, which can result in residual fibers and an uneven mixture.
• The invention measures the entire momentary quantity of the stored fiber lot before each pass and determines a partial quantity that corresponds to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity.
• The method ensures that all fiber bales are opened without fiber residuals and that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.
• The invention also sets a predetermined period for the removal of individual quantity proportions to maintain a determined time schedule in the opening of the fiber bales.
• The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device associated with the opener, and a control device that controls the mode of operation of the opener as a function of the signals transmitted by the quantity measuring device.
• The quantity measuring device can be a frequency counter, a weighing device, or a height-measuring arrangement that determines the partial fiber quantities to be removed from the bales based on the height of the fiber bale.
• The control apparatus controls the displacement of the transporting device, the beginning and end of the bale opening operation, and the reversal of the direction of operation of the bale opener.

• The invention describes a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics, where the yarns in at least two of the layers of fabric are laid at an angle of 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric. The yarns in the various layers are held together by stitching through the layers or by other external means such as adhesive bonding.
• The invention provides a rake mechanism, synchronized with, but driven separately from, the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism, to achieve greater assurance of parallelism of the yarns. The rake mechanism also allows for successive courses of yarn to overlie a portion of an already laid course, which helps control the strength and thickness of the resulting layer. The yarns can be placed between adjacent needles or impaled on them, and the rake needles are formed at an angle to correspond to and supplement the angle of the approaching yarns.

• The invention describes methods and apparatuses for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom, with varying weft carrying forces and stable conditions to prevent excessive consumption of pressurized air.
• The first embodiment includes a pneumatic piping system with subnozzles divided into groups, supplying different additional weft carrying forces for two different weft threads.
• The second embodiment produces different weft carrying forces by providing subnozzles with different orifice diameters or supplying air under different pressures.
• The third embodiment uses directional control valves to supply air under pressure through different paths selectively to the subnozzles.
• The fourth embodiment selectively supplies a weft inserting main nozzle and weft carrying subnozzles with air under different pressures, controlled by a weft selection signal and on-off command signals.

<summary>
 
- The invention describes a process for spinning bast fibers, such as jute, kenaf, or hemp, which includes health preserving the fibers twice, once before and once after carding, to improve flexibility and spinnability, thereby reducing the end breakage rate.
- The process involves health preserving the bast fibers in a temperature range of 30°C to 80°C, relative humidity of 80% to 100%, and for a duration of 2 to 14 hours. The health preserved bast fibers are then carded, drawn into strips, and health preserved again before spinning into yarn.
- The invention also describes a process for blended spinning bast fibers and other fibers, such as cotton, terylene, or polypropylene, with a weight percentage of bast fibers ranging from 20% to 99%. The blended fibers are health preserved in a temperature range of 30°C to 80°C, relative humidity of 80% to 100%, and for a duration of 2 to 14 hours before spinning into yarn.
</summary>

The above summary is a concise and accurate representation of the main points covered in the provided text. It highlights the key features of the invention, including the health preservation process for bast fibers and blended fibers, the temperature, humidity, and duration ranges for health preservation, and the weight percentage of bast fibers in blended fibers.

* The present invention is a method and apparatus for measuring and removing the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses which utilize imbedded sensors in covered rolls. This is achieved by using multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to cancel the effects of rotational variability.
* The present invention compensates for rotational variability in the sensing mechanism by calculating, for example, an average pressure value at each cross-directional position or by using curve fitting models. This results in a more accurate representation of the actual pressure distribution across the nip press, which can be used in collaboration with correcting instrumentation to eliminate or compensate for pressure variability at locations across the sensing roll.
</summary>

The present invention provides apparatus and methods for accurately detecting, measuring and at least partially removing any effects of rotational variability from a covered roll (also referred to as a “sensing roll”) used in nip presses. The present invention compensates for this effect allowing a more accurate display of the nip pressure profile to be calculated and displayed. The present invention thus provides the machine operator with a more accurate representation of the actual pressure distribution across the nip press. The present invention could be used in collaboration with correcting instrumentation which can eliminate or compensate for pressure variability at locations across the sensing roll of the press. The data obtained from the arrangement of sensors along the sensing roll allows for the calculation and display of a rotational variability profile which can provide the operator with additional real time information concerning the dynamics of the pressure readings in order to obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile. The present invention can compensate for rotational variability in the sensing mechanism by calculating, for example, an average pressure value at each cross-directional position along the sensing roll. The present invention also could calculate and obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile utilizing other models, such as curve fitting.

The present invention uses multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll in order to cancel the effects of rotational variability which may, or may not, be acting on the sensing roll. * This invention describes an apparatus for supporting an electrical cord of an electrical appliance, such as an electric iron, and holding articles like spray starch cans or beverage containers.
* The apparatus includes a clamp to attach it to an ironing board, a flexible cord support to keep the cord above the ironing surface, and a detachable article holder.
* The cord support can be moved between a raised position and a retracted position for storage, and the article holder can be removed when not in use.
* The apparatus also includes an electrical receptacle for receiving the plug of the electrical cord.

● The invention is a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that can create buttonholes of consistent length regardless of the type of material being sewn.

● The device includes a foot pad attached to a presser bar, a travelling assembly with a slidable member, and an adjustable stop.

● The slidable member can be positioned by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn and carries a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine during movement of the assembly.

● The adjustable stop engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of a buttonhole, allowing the operator to precisely define the closure point and prevent open or overlapping buttonholes.

● The device is adapted to control the operation of a tripping lever, which in turn controls flexible contacts to cause the machine to sew a buttonhole when in a buttonhole mode.

● The device can be adjusted for different types of materials by adjusting the position of the actuating tab with respect to the adjustable stop, and can be further fine-tuned by adjusting a screw connected to the adjustable stop.

<summary>
 
* This invention describes an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid using a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
* The conveyor includes an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a predetermined horizontal path. The applicator applies the liquid to the web during motion, and the suction device removes the liquid from the web by a suction process during motion.
* The dwell stretch conducts the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop, lengthening the action time of the applied liquid on the substances to be removed from the fabric or textile web.
* This invention is especially advantageous for printed material as effective washing is possible without soiling a white background, and the web is not placed into a stacked configuration or run through a vat.

• The text describes the operation of a dry cleaning machine that includes a separate circulating system for solvent flow and air flow. The solvent flow system includes a pump, filters, a button trap, and a housing, and the air flow system includes a header chamber, airflow hoses, and electrically energized one-way valves. The machine also includes a safety line that connects the button tank with a solvent vapor handling line leading directly into the storage tank.

• The machine is designed to prevent airflow through the tub during the spin cycle in order to minimize the undesirable phenomena of "streaks and swales" caused by uneven drying of clothes. The refrigeration system is used to condense solvent vapor and maintain a fixed temperature during the drying portion of the cycle. The machine also includes a control mechanism for purposely altering the timer operation to dry the filter cartridges prior to replacement.

* The present invention describes a method and apparatus for forming a melt spun nonwoven web using a two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width, which produces a linear plane of filaments with constant filament distribution.
* The system uses the same air for quenching and drawing the filaments, reducing the number of required air sources and associated equipment. The small drawing chamber and lack of nozzle length parallel to the fiber/air stream allow for higher quench pressures and velocities.
* The apparatus and method have several advantages over prior art systems, including simpler process equipment, easier cleaning, improved web formation control, and the ability to accommodate a wide variety of materials and operating conditions.

The present invention pertains to methods and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments and, more particularly, to improvements therein using non-eductive drawing. The invention harnesses the positive aspects of both eductive and non-eductive (and hybrid) systems into a more efficient and simpler design. The invention solves many of the problems associated with conventional nonwoven spun bond systems including: spinning speed limitations, energy consumption, machine element cleanliness (i.e., hygiene), web uniformity, capital costs and process control. The invention also incorporates aspects of another, different type of nonwoven web forming technology, the meltblown process, to help improve web formation control. The method of the invention involves providing a thermoplastic polymer in fluid condition for spinning, feeding it through a screw extruder, filter, and polymer transfer pipe to a spin box containing metering pumps. Filaments are spun through a spinneret with appropriate openings into a quench chamber, where they are contacted with air or other cooling fluid received through fluid inlet and diffused through perforated apertured plates. The quench fluid, usually air, is maintained cooler than the filaments and supplied under pressure of less than 4 bar. The filament curtain is then directed through a narrowing lower end of the quenching chamber into the impingement point slot opening where the quench air attains a velocity that can be anywhere in the approximate range of 3,000 to 21,000 meters per minute. The drawing slot extends across the full machine width and is preferably formed by two identical air

1. The sewing machine includes a bed, a pillar, an arm, and a head. The bed is a base portion of the sewing machine and extends in the left-right direction. The pillar extends upward from the right end of the bed. The arm extends to the left from the upper end of the pillar such that the arm faces the bed. The head is provided on the left end of the arm.
2. The sewing machine includes a needle plate, a feed dog, a feed mechanism, a shuttle mechanism, a feed adjustment motor, a needle bar mechanism, a needle bar swinging motor, a receiver, a cover, a thread spool, an upper thread, a presser bar, a presser foot, and a plurality of operation switches.
3. The sewing machine includes a liquid crystal display (LCD) and a touch panel. The touch panel detects a position pressed by a finger or a dedicated touch pen, and the sewing machine determines the item that corresponds to the detected position.
4. The sewing machine includes connectors for connecting an external storage device and an ultrasonic pen. The sewing machine may read out pattern data and various programs from the external storage device connected to the connector. The sewing machine may supply electric power to the ultrasonic pen via the connector and may acquire an electrical signal output from the ultrasonic pen. The ultrasonic pen includes a pen body, a pen tip, a switch, a signal output circuit, and an ultrasonic transmitter. The switch is turned on and off in accordance with the position of the pen tip. The signal output circuit outputs an electrical signal to the sewing machine via the cable when the switch is turned on. The ultrasonic transmitter transmits an ultrasonic wave when the switch is turned on. The sewing machine can receive (detect) the ultrasonic wave transmitted from the ultrasonic pen using the receivers. Based on the detected ultrasonic wave, the sewing machine can identify a transmission source of the ultrasonic wave, namely, the position of the ultrasonic transmitter provided in the ultrasonic pen. The sewing machine can perform sewing based on the identified position.

* The wool particles or wool powder used in the preparation are of macrofibril size or below, and have demonstrated exceptional functional additive-carrying and retention ability.
* The preparation can be used to enhance various functional properties of textile articles, such as ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial, and moisture management properties.

Explanation:

* The invention describes a method for enhancing the durability of functional enhancements of cellulosic fabric materials using a preparation with wool particles or wool powder as carriers for functional additives. This is achieved by pulverizing wool to obtain ultrafine wool powder of macrofibril size, and forming an ultrafine wool suspension using the ultrafine wool powder. The wool particles or wool powder used in the preparation are of macrofibril size or below, and have demonstrated exceptional functional additive-carrying and retention ability.
* The preparation can be used to enhance various functional properties of textile articles, such as ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial, and moisture management properties. The functional additive can include additives for ultraviolet protection, anti-bacteria, or other clothing functions. The wool particles or wool powder may have a size of 200 nm or below, and a helix or helical structure capable of carrying the functional additives. The functional additive may comprise an anti-UV (ultraviolet light) agent, such as zinc oxide, or titanium oxide, bamboo powder, or anti-bacterial agents such as nano-silver, zinc oxide, titanium oxide, or other functional comparable agents.
* The preparation can be applied onto cellulosic fabric materials using various methods, such as printing, padding, or foam application. The bonding or deposition may be by printing, padding or foam application. The method may comprise adding 0.5-2g/l wetting agent and 4-10g/l

• The present invention is a frame quilting machine that includes a large metal frame, a reprogrammable function for stitching patterns into a fabric, and a computer aided design program for creating and duplicating patterns. The machine is controlled by two separate computers: one for the sewing machine function and one for the quilting table motion. This allows for independent reprogramming of the sewing machine and table motion, simplifying the process of making adjustments or changes to the stitch or accessory functions or the table movement.

• The machine is designed for stitching individualized patterns into large fabrics such as bedspreads or quilts. The fabric is stretched on the metal frame, which is mounted on a table that can be moved in the X, Y, or X-Y direction. The sewing machine head is mounted on a cross beam and stitches patterns into the fabric as the table moves relative to the fixed sewing machine head. The reprogrammable function allows the operator to manually draw a pattern on a monitor, which is then converted into computer language and stored in the memory of the computer. The pattern can then be duplicated as often as desired and the machine will automatically stitch the pattern into the marked locations on the fabric.

<summary>

* The invention is a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image for various consumer applications.
* The process involves carding and aligning fibers into a feedstock, drawing and blending the fibers, reducing their diameter, and spinning them into yarn.
* The yarns are then wound onto larger packages and used to create a woven fabric through a complex, multi-step process.
* Nonwoven fabrics are produced more efficiently by forming them directly from the carding process.
* Hydroentangled fabrics have been developed with improved properties, such as resistance to elongation, by the formation of complex composite structures.
* Nonwoven composite structures typically improve physical properties, such as elongation, by incorporating a support layer or scrim.
* Spunbond material, which comprises continuous filaments, is used as a reinforcing layer or scrim due to its high resistance to elongation.
* Hydroentanglement techniques have been developed to impart images or patterns to the entangled fabric by effecting hydroentanglement on three-dimensional image transfer devices.
* The two-sided, three-dimensionally imaged nonwoven fabric of the present invention is useful as a wipe, with sufficient softness for intimate contact with the skin and the ability to exfoliate.

</summary>

* The invention describes a sewing machine device that includes a guide chute for feeding a strip of add-on material over the bed plate, where the material is fed into association with a workpiece. A stop is arranged in the feed path of the strip for contacting and stopping the feeding thereof, which is displaceable out of the path and connectable by control means to the sewing machine for controlling the operation of the sewing machine in accordance with the position of the stop and the strip material.
* The device includes a control setup with a stop in the feed path of the strip for contacting and preventing feed thereof when the strip is not fed in correct association with the fabric. The stop is carried by a doubled arm lever member which is part of a control means including a control switch and a setting means for adjusting the position of the stop.
* The sewing machine control is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.

<summary>
 
* The invention describes a connective knitting method for two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
* The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces in different ranges across the boundary, then overlaying and binding off the loops at the end to join them.
* The rear moving needle bed is moved to transfer the loop portion of the final course of one knit fabric to the other needle bed.
* The loop portion of the end part of the moving side knit fabric is overlaid on the loop of the end part of the adjoining fixed side knit fabric.
* A new loop is formed on the overlaid part, decreasing one loop in the moving side knit fabric and two loops in total.
* By repeating this sequence, the end parts of both knit fabrics are joined and the final end portion of the junction is prevented from loosening.
* The joined ends are arranged in subsequent courses, and the end-to-end joined state is shown in figures.
* The invention can be applied to various parts of garments, such as the collar part of a sweater, the neck rope part of a tanktop, the lower end portion of baseball stockings, and the neck rope part of an apron.
* The two pieces of knit fabric are knitted together and the transfers are carried out by a controlled computer following a designed knitting pattern.
* The method can improve productivity, reduce manufacturing cost, and provide a neater appearance and better comfort for the wearer.
</summary>

• The invention describes a traction element, a production line, and a method for producing a traction element with increased flexibility and improved adhesion between the stranded cables and the plastics material jacket.
• The traction element has a core strand sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer, and is produced by winding at least six peripheral strand cords around the core strand. The strand cords themselves consist of individual fibers or wires of a material guaranteeing tensile strength.
• The production line includes an extruder with a thread guide for the stranded cables and at least one matrix, which can be adjusted in relation to one another to control the spacing of the stranded cables. Pressure rollers may be used to correct the position of the stranded cables in the still soft plastics material.
• The method for embedding at least one stranded cable with a plastics material-coated core strand involves degreasing and/or pre-treating the unwound stranded cables, preheating them to a temperature of about ±20° C. of the melting temperature of the flexible thermoplastic plastics material sheathing the core strands, and sheathing them in the extruder with the liquefied plastics material.
• The improvement in adhesion between the stranded cables and the plastics material jacket is achieved through the degreasing or coating of the free surface of the stranded cables with an adhesion-promoting layer and the preheating to about ±20° C. of the melting temperature of the liquefied plastics material. This results in a sharp improvement in the adhesion that lasts over long-term and intensive use.

• The invention is a lockstitch sewing machine with a rotary hook arrangement that minimizes interference with the guiding of the needle thread loop, particularly during pull-back.
• The housing side holding means are located on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, allowing the needle thread loop to expand fully before being pulled back by the thread take-up lever.
• The needle thread loop moves through a gap between the front cam and the shoulder, then briefly bends a low-mass spring rod, causing only a slight increase in needle thread tension.
• A capsule release device can eliminate this slight impediment by giving the bobbin housing a rotational impulse, allowing the needle thread loop to slip through the thread passage gap unhindered.
• The rotary hook arrangement is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.
• The sewing machine comprises a base plate, standard, arm, needle bar, threaded needle, thread take-up lever, thread tensioning device, rotary hook drive shaft, bevel gear, counter-gear, lockstitch rotary hook, hook body, hook tip, bobbin housing, bobbin capsule carrier, removable bobbin capsule, projections, thread opening, stitch hole, shoulder, thread, and capsule release device.

<summary>

• The invention relates to methods for producing silicon-containing nanowire/fiber composites and thin films using liquid silane inks by electrospinning.
• Four-component and five-component liquid silane-based inks are used to produce nanowire products, which can be used as a component of other material compositions such as an anode for a lithium-ion battery.
• The electrospinning process involves expelling a viscous solution of a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent through a nozzle and exposing it to a high electric field, resulting in the formation of continuous fibers that are deposited onto a substrate.
• The substrate can be a metallic foil, a conducting carbon fiber matte, a rotating mandrel, or a moving metal web.
• The deposited and collected nanowires can be transformed using thermal processing or laser processing to produce polysilane-containing materials, amorphous silicon-containing materials, or crystalline silicon-containing materials.
• Optionally, the transformed fibers can be coated with a coherent, conductive coating and used as a component of composite materials such as an anode material for a lithium-ion battery.
• The coating can be deposited by chemical vapor deposition or solution deposition.
• Five-component inks may have essentially the same components as the four-component inks with the addition of a solid phase, which may be a particulate, photoactive, or reactive compound.
• The solid phase component can be transformed using thermal processing or laser processing to produce amorphous silicon or crystalline silicon composites.

</summary>

<summary>
 
* The invention is related to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel.
* The arrangement includes a plurality of spool holders, each having a controller with a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension responsive, braking element.
* A tensioning lever, coupled to the braking element, biases it and is operable to occupy an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight.
* A biasing arrangement, activated by fluid pressure, is connected to the tensioning lever and can be simultaneously set for all the biasing arrangements.
* The force generated by the biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, altering the thread tension.
* The braking force throughout the creel can be increased when the warping machine served by the creel is shut off, allowing for quick braking action.
* The tensioning lever ensures that the braking shoe on restart of the warping machine is removed from contact with the braking surface, preventing locking.
* The braking element can be a braking band or a magnetic system, and the brake rotor can be a brake drum or a braking disc.
* A pneumatic biasing arrangement is preferred, as it can readily follow the swinging movement of the tensioning lever and prevent contamination of the threads.
* The tensioning lever should subtend an angle of more than 45° to the horizontal plane, and the working elevation angle of the biasing arrangement should subtend an angle of less than 45°.
</summary>

• The present invention is a sewing machine detector that can detect the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine.
• The detector is integral with the drive and control elements of the sewing machine.
• The detector includes a sewing machine shaft, a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft, and needle UP and DOWN position detecting reflective discs installed on the shaft.
• Light from a needle UP position detecting optical fiber and a needle DOWN position detecting optical fiber is reflected by the reflecting portions of the reflective discs and received by light receiving optical fibers.
• The reflected light is processed by a signal processing circuit and transmitted to the control circuit section for controlling the sewing machine.
• The detector eliminates the influence of static noise due to friction and other noise, preventing malfunction and ensuring stable sewing machine operations.
• The detector includes flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs that detect the sewing machine speed, needle UP and DOWN positions, and thread trimmer timing position.
• The detector includes an optical fiber supporter that holds the optical fibers in place, reducing stress and ensuring accurate optical axes.
• The detector includes a power indicating window that receives light from a power indicating optical fiber, eliminating interference and noise problems.
• The detector provides for the easy generation and maintenance of accurate optical axes, reducing manufacturing costs and resulting in a thinner, more compact detecting section.

* The invention describes a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
  * The process includes completing coagulation, washing with water having a non-alkaline pH, drying, and possibly finishing.
  * The coagulation index should be attained through various methods such as passing time, acid treatment, or a succession of both.
  * The wash water should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5, and should be free from cations in higher amounts.
  * The process is carried out with spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min, and the washing is carried out at specific temperatures and for a certain period of time.
  * The invention results in a finished yarn with a high degree of white, and other auxiliary treatments may be added to the aforesaid treatments.

• The document describes a patent for a small deaeration tank used for deaerating pulp that has been treated with oxygen before washing.
• The deaeration tank is designed to be placed on top of an oxygen reactor and have no moving parts.
• The tank is filled with a swirling fluid, such as filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach, which helps to deaerate the pulp.
• The system includes an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe, all strategically located to optimize deaeration.
• The deaerated pulp leaves the tank through line 32 to pulp washer 33.
• The filtrate from the pulp mat is carried by line 46 to the deaeration tank 28 to be used as the swirling fluid in the deaeration tank.
• The deaeration tank is designed to be the same diameter as the oxygen reactor and built to withstand pressures of ±1 atmosphere.
• The tank has an exterior height of approximately 2"D", where D is the exterior diameter of the tank.
• The nominal height of the pulp slurry in the deaeration tank is 0.8"D".
