- The invention describes biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties including high structural performance and strength-to-weight ratio. The BTR composite structure comprises a plurality of spaced-apart stuffer members, tendon elements, and two panels bonded to the first and second ends of the stuffer members. The stuffer members may be parallel, radially aligned, or without any common center point, and the panels may have convex, concave, or flat outer surfaces. The tendon elements may be made of carbon fibers, nylon, Kevlar, glass fibers, plant fibers, or metal wires, and the stuffer members may be rigid, semi-rigid, or flexible components made of metal, ceramic, or plastic. The stuffer members and tendon elements may be embedded in a matrix material such as epoxy resin, metallic or ceramic foams, polymers, thermal isolation materials, acoustic isolation materials, and/or vibration-resistant materials.
- The invention uses a methodology called "function-oriented material design" (FOMD) to design materials for specific, demanding tasks. The FOMD process involves defining and quantifying the functions of a particular structure, such as supporting static loads, dissipating or confining vibration energy, or absorbing impact energy, and then optimizing the material design based on these objectives and constraints. The BTR composite concept was obtained through a topology optimization process that maximizes the out-plane stiffness of a composite made of carbon fiber and epoxy matrix material. The concept involves evenly distributing fibers in the matrix material and treating materials in tension and compression differently in the composite.
- The BTR composite structure includes six fundamental components: tendons/muscles, ribs/bones, joints, flesh, skins, and shell. The two-dimensional material concept may be extended to a three-dimensional lattice, which can be made of various raw materials such as steel frame, steel columns, carbon-fiber ropes, and carbon fiber/epoxy cover panels. A potential fabrication procedure involves inserting bent-wire tendon elements into the ends of stuffer members to create linear structures, which can be replicated to create a planar structure. If panels are added, a lightweight yet rigid structure results.
- The invention can be used

• The invention describes a load-limiting device for braced frames that can undergo plastic deformation to limit the loads transmitted to a structure during a dynamic event, and can be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation.
• The load-limiting device is able to plastically deform in response to a load applied thereto, and may have elasto-plastic properties to allow for formation of a plastic hinge mechanism.
• The system includes a braced frame structure having at least one beam and a first column and a second column, a brace frame structure having at least one brace, and a load-limiting device releasably attached to the brace and detachably coupled to the braced frame structure.
• The method includes providing a braced frame having at least one beam and two side columns, integrating at least one brace into the braced frame, integrating a load-limiting device into the system, and providing a connection means to connect the load-limiting device to the braced frame.

• The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet designed for use in a flophouse facility, with a dual construction consisting of an outer casing and an inner casing, providing increased mechanical strength and efficient use of space.
• The clearance between the outer and inner casings can be used to house boxes for electric devices or shelves for personal belongings, without projecting from the cabinet, allowing for natural ventilation and sound-proofing.
• The bedroom cabinet can be assembled by fitting the lower half of the inner casing into the lower outer casing, and then fitting the upper outer casing on top, with flanges resiliently held by a clip member.
• The inner casing is connected and fixed by seals or a fit-in type groove, and the assembled bedroom cabinet can house various electric devices, with wiring work able to be achieved easily.
• The second embodiment of the invention features a spacer member interposed between the outer casings and the interior body, forming a clearance that acts as an intake and exhaust passage, sound-proofing wall, and can house an illuminating device, interphone, and other devices.

- The text describes a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the construction industry to provide a safe work area for workmen working at dangerous heights. The guard rail support consists of a flat bottomed base plate, an upright column, guard rail support brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring. The guard rail support can be used to construct a safety barrier with wooden guard rails, overlapping wooden rails, or a safety mesh structure. The guard rail support can be secured to a floor or ground surface using suitable fastening means, or it can be used with a concrete-filled steel base for greater stability and support.
- The guard rail support is designed to meet safety guidelines and can be assembled and disassembled in an efficient manner. It provides numerous advantages such as serving as retaining and attachment means for a safety cable, fastening weatherproof tarpaulins to protect workmen and the site under construction from inclement weather conditions, and providing structural stability. The guard rail support can be used along the perimeter of a floor under construction, around the perimeter of a roof structure, along the sides of a bridge construction, or along any drop-off edge wherever it may occur.

<summary>

* The document is a continuation-in-part of U.S. patent application Ser. No. 09/500,669, filed on Feb. 9, 2000, now U.S. Pat. No. ______.
* The invention relates to the stimulation of crude oil reservoirs to enhance production using a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods and the processing of the recovered crude oil into its components.
* The method and apparatus use pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic discharges in one or more wells that produce acoustic and coupled electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations to enhance oil flow and increase the estimated ultimate recovery from reservoirs.
* The background section discusses the need for an EOR technology that can be deployed easily and at low cost in onshore and offshore field locations to improve the performance of many oil fields and increase significantly the world's known recoverable oil reserves.
* The prior art includes methods that rely on the injection of fluid at one well, called the injection well, to flush the in situ hydrocarbons out of the formation to a producing well. These methods become less efficient once the injected fluid attains a continuous phase between the injection well and the production well.
* Electrical methods and heating of the formation are also discussed as categories of methods used for EOR.
* The document also discusses the limitations of existing acoustic stimulation methods, including their limited range of effectiveness and the natural attenuation properties of reservoirs that absorb high frequencies preferentially.
* The invention aims to address these limitations by using a stimulation source with a greater range of effectiveness and the ability to provide stimulation at higher frequencies than the 10-500 Hz typically attainable using prior art methods.
* The invention builds on the teachings of U.S. Pat. No. 4,345,650 issued to Wesley and extends the effective range of Wesley's method through new and novel equipment designs and field configurations of Wesley's apparatus and new apparatus designed to enhance the effect on oil reservoirs.
</summary>

• The present application is a continuation-in-part of a co-pending patent application for a Wave Anchor Soil Reinforcing Connector and Method.
• Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures are retaining wall structures that use horizontally positioned soil inclusions to reinforce an earth mass in combination with a facing element.
• A typical soil reinforcing element for MSE structures includes a welded wire grid with longitudinal and transverse wires. The wall end of the element may include connective means to connect it to a vertical facing.
• There is a need for a system and method of splicing a soil reinforcing element to extend its length.
• An exemplary splice includes a first wave plate with transverse protrusions to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element, and a second wave plate with transverse protrusions to receive and seat a corresponding number of transverse wires of a grid-strip. A connective device extends through perforations in the wave plates to couple them together and clamp down on the longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and the grid strip.
• A composite soil reinforcing element includes a soil reinforcing element, a grid-strip, and a splice that couples the reinforcing end of the soil reinforcing element to the splicing end of the grid-strip. The splice includes wave plates that define transverse protrusions to receive and seat the transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and the grid-strip, and a connective device that extends through perforations in the wave plates to couple them together and clamp down on the longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and the grid-strip.

- The present invention describes a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, which can be manufactured efficiently using basic processes. The blade construction includes a multiple component assembly, allowing for rebuilding and replacing worn portions. Ejecting fluid at specific points along the blade reduces drag and friction, and the method is adaptable for both static and vibratory plowing utilities.
- The invention also describes various embodiments of the plow blade, including a plow with a fluid tube that transfers pressurized fluid from the top of the plow into a void in the leading edge section, and a plow with a manifold that allows for control of flow rates and location of fluid injection. Another embodiment features a fluid tube located on the opposite side of the blade, protected by plates and sealed with welds. The fluid is then forced into a void that intersects with the bottom-front corner of the blade, allowing the fluid to flow along the front edge.

<summary>

* The invention is a building system that allows for the creation of larger exterior panels without the need for movement control joints.
* The system uses a reinforced plaster panel with a first mesh attached to battens and a second mesh supported by a plaster matrix.
* The panels can be of various sizes and shapes, including those with openings such as doors and windows, which are further reinforced in the plaster matrix.
* The system can be used with various types of mesh, including metal and non-metallic, and can include additional regional reinforcement as needed.
* The panels can be formed in situ using a cavity wall type structure with a frame or substructure, battens, and a paper or like wrap.
* The system can be used to create stucco walls with a thickness of about 21 mm and a size of at least 2.4×4 m without movement control joints.
* The system can be used to create building envelopes with perimeters larger than 2.4 mm×4 m and with movement control joints as needed.
* The system can be used to create various types of building structures, including those with intersecting walls and those with cavity wall type structures.
</summary>

Note: The above summary is a general overview of the invention and may not include all the details and features of the system as described in the text. It is recommended to refer to the full text for a more complete understanding of the invention.

<summary>

- The invention describes a new and improved safe and door structure, which is a readily assembled, low cost door and safe structure. The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening and a first set of inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls for placement of a plate-shaped separate steel door. A set of grooves formed on the opposite walls provide stops for retaining the door therein. The lock assembly on the reverse side of the door has the latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement with reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt preventing transmission of force to the lock mechanism in the event of forceful intrusion attempts.
- The safe construction can be formed utilizing the construction described in applicant's U.S. Pat. No. 4,176,440, which is an in-place construction wherein a liner, preferably formed of an appropriate plastic material, is employed as a combination liner and form for the pouring of concrete thereabout to provide the majority of the body of the floor safe. The invention is equally applicable to a safe which is formed of all metal, such as by steel fabrication or steel casting methods.
- The door is formed of a generally rectangular steel plate member having a lower edge thereof rounded for reasons which will be hereafter discussed. Located relatively centrally on, and extending therough the plate member is a lockset, which includes a combination dial accessible from the exterior of the door. The lockset is secured to the bottom or interior of plate member such as by bolts and includes a slidable lockbolt, which is movable from a position within the housing of the lockset to an extended position, shown in FIG. 3 into engagement with the notch.
- The door is dimensioned for being received in and completely removed from the open upper end of the chamber. For this purpose, the plate member of the door is generally rectangularly configured, or square, in plan elevation with the width thereof closely approximating the width of the chamber. The length of the plate member of the door is dimensioned to provide clearance while inserting at an angle as shown in dotted lines in FIG. 2, with the rounded lower edge positioned in the groove formed beneath the intruding inner edge of groove which is reinforced with bar member.

- The document describes various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems that more accurately measure the formation pressures at desired depths. The inlet to the pressure sensing apparatus is located at a desired depth in the formation and isolated to pressures produced by the formation at such depth, ensuring the measurement of the formation pressure is not affected by other and different pressures that could exist in the borehole above and below the inlet to the pressure measuring apparatus.
- The systems described involve placing a pressure transducer in a borehole at a desired location, fixing it in place with cement grout, and then creating a communication path between the formation and the pressure transducer after the cement grout has set. This is accomplished by pumping a liquid down the borehole through a check valve to clear the filter of cement grout and then displace the grout so that the filter is in communication with the formation pressure to be measured. In some cases, a hydrofracture process may be used once the grout has set to ensure connectivity.

• The invention describes a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function, which can be used in new transit systems, monorails, road bridges, and footbridges.
• The jointing structure includes multiple steps with an expansion gap between them, elastic members inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap. This design prevents tire fall-in and stuck-in situations and ensures smooth vehicle traveling.
• The elastic members are made of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and easy to be deformed horizontally, and are fitted to the joint block detachably by bolting or the like. Supporting blocks can also be mounted inside the steps to protect the traveling path ends.
• The expansion gap can be decentralized into more than one expansion gap by mounting intermediate joint blocks inside the steps, which can prevent the occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations and increase driving quality.
• The use of joint blocks, supporting blocks, and intermediate joint blocks of the same quality as the traveling path or high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete can lead to facilitated difference-in-level management and increased in-traveling safety for vehicles.

• The invention is a floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber, specifically designed for moving wheeled trucks or similar vehicles into and out of the chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment.
• The system includes a wheel channel that stands off the floor, supported by legs, and has opposed sidewalls with a cover plate overlying the top of the channel, preventing fluid from entering the wheel channel area and becoming contaminated.
• The cover plate may be hinged to the longer sidewall, allowing it to be pivoted away for cleaning purposes.
• Another embodiment of the system accommodates trucks with downwardly depending struts supporting the wheel structure, using inflatable elastomer seals along the sidewall top edges to enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent entry of the brine solution.
• The system is designed for use in meat product chilling chambers, where wheeled hand trucks carry meat products into the chamber and brine solution is used for quick cooling.
• The enclosed floor track system prevents brine solution from being showered onto the wheel structure of the hand trucks and becoming contaminated.
• The system is supported above the chamber floor by support legs and has an incline to drain washing fluids into the waste sewer.
• The tracks include a wheel channel with a wheel guide in the center to keep the hand truck centered within the bottom of the track system.
• The cover plate is hinged to the outer sidewall and can be pivoted away to facilitate cleaning.
• The system helps in the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving natural resources and achieving economic advantages.

- The present invention relates to a lock device that prevents a work machine, such as a boom of a backhoe work machine, from being tilted or rotated downward by its own weight.
- The lock device includes an engaging member with a hook part and a slot, and an engaged member that can engage with the hook part. The engaging member is supported by a guide member and a support pin inserted into the slot. The guide member ensures that the engaging member maintains the lock position at any rotation position of the boom between its highest and lowest positions.
- The lock device is designed to be easy to operate manually, with the engaging member easily held in the lock position or lock release position by sliding it along the slot and touching the guide member with either the first or second surface of the engaging member.
- The lock device is simple in design, with no need for a holding mechanism, slip-prevention member, or additional guide member, reducing the number of parts and assembly processes, and prolonging the life of the lock mechanism.

• The present invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with an adjustable platform to regulate suction efficiency during cleaning.
• The invention includes adjustment mechanisms on the top of the suction head to control the spacing between the suction head and the pool bottom, allowing for real-time suction adjustments without changing the vacuum at the circulation pump.
• The adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located and can be quickly operated by hand without the need for hand tools.
• The invention can be provided in kit form to interconnect with certain types of existing, prior art pool cleaning devices without the need for major retrofit.
• The adjustment mechanism is simple, easy to use, and inexpensive to manufacture.

<summary>
 
* The invention is a tool for retrieving wear bushings in oil well drilling tools and apparatuses.
* Wear sleeves or bushings protect against excessive wear in seal areas of casing heads and other well head elements.
* The tool retrieves the wear bushing without the use of a bit, using a sub-unit mounted on the drill string.
* The tool includes means for engaging with an extended J-slot of a wear bushing and preventing rotational movement.
* The tool allows for vertical movement to prevent damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing.
* The tool can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieval of the drill bit from the hole.
* The tool is easily removable and installable for quickly removing the wear bushing during the drilling operation.
* The tool includes a retriever section with protruding members for engaging with the wear bushing.
* The tool also includes a sub-unit with a mandrel and a longitudinal bore, and a removable lower collar section for threadably engaging the end of a second lower section of drill pipe.
* The tool allows for the retrieval of a specific type of wear bushing with a threaded collar section using a threaded lower end section of the retriever.
</summary>

The summary above provides a brief overview of the main points covered in the source text. It includes information on the purpose of the invention, how it works, and its features and benefits. The summary is written in bullet point format for easy readability and comprehension. It is important to note that the summary is not a substitute for the source text and is intended to be a brief overview of the main points covered in the text.

<summary>

- The invention is a downhole vibratory tool that allows a wireline or other tools to pass through it.
- The tool has a modular piston stack that increases the power of the pressure spike applied to the stuck object or "fish."
- The tool is activated by dropping a simple plug into the passage to seal its lower end.
- The valve design allows for wireline access before the plug is dropped and eliminates slamming any part of the valve against a seat.
- The valve and spring components are designed to better perform in a cyclical loading environment without fatigue or failure.
- The tool can be configured to operate with fewer moving parts than previous designs.
- The design eliminates significant cyclical impacts on opening and closing of the valve.
- The tool can be made to operate with or without impacts of the pistons on the housing.
- The tool can be used in stimulation or fishing operations and can have a rotational lock for torque transmission.
- The invention is not limited to the specific embodiments described, but is intended to be as broad as the claims.

</summary>

Note: The summary is a brief overview of the main points of the text and is not intended to replace the original text. It is always recommended to read the full text for a complete understanding of the invention.

<summary>

* The invention describes a precast concrete retaining wall system with a base and a face panel with an integral counterfort, connected together on site.
* The counterfort extends perpendicularly from the face panel and its base extends rearward, providing additional support and helping to meet design loads.
* Rebars can be cast within the counterfort and base for added strength, and can terminate in various configurations to act as anchors.
* The base is generally a rectangular or trapezoidal platform, typically set on grade and precast concrete, and does not require casting in-situ at the construction site.
* The face panel and counterfort can be connected to the base using a shear key and grout, and multiple walls can be placed adjacent to one another to form a continuous wall.

</summary>

Explanation:

* The invention presents a new design for a retaining wall system made of precast concrete, consisting of a base and a face panel with an integral counterfort.
* The counterfort is a key feature of the design, extending perpendicularly from the face panel and providing additional support, particularly in the lower part of the wall where overturning forces are greatest.
* Rebars are used within the counterfort and base to meet design loads and provide added strength. The rebars can terminate in various configurations to act as anchors.
* The base is a rectangular or trapezoidal platform, typically set on grade and precast concrete, eliminating the need for casting in-situ at the construction site.
* The face panel and counterfort can be connected to the base using a shear key and grout, and multiple walls can be placed adjacent to one another to form a continuous wall, with the option to use shear keys or ship laps between adjacent walls for flexibility.

<summary>

- The invention is a down-hole heating system for oil and gas wells to increase flow rates impeded by high oil viscosity and/or paraffin blockage.
- The system includes production tubing, a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, a stainless steel tubing collar, and a heating unit with electrical resistance heater rods.
- The heat insulating packer and stainless steel collars contain the heat within the desired zone, focusing it on the production formation to heat the oil and paraffin in situ, allowing it to flow to the well bore for pumping.
- The internal connection of the heating unit is impenetrably shielded from pressures and hostile chemical agents in the well bore using a cement block and steel fitting assembly.
- Solid copper leads with KAPTON insulation are used to reliably deliver power to the connection.
- The method for using the system includes installing the heating unit with shielded electrical connections and heat-retaining elements to focus heat on the producing formation, and it can be used with cable for supporting the heating unit during other well treatments or maintenance.
</summary>

• The invention describes a mechanism for installing and retrieving down hole objects in wells, such as a fishing tool used to remove objects stuck in a well bore. The tool includes an expandable collet type device for establishing internal connection with the object and a controllable locking mechanism for locking and unlocking the tool with respect to the object.
• The tool can be used in various service operations, such as drilling, well servicing, and fishing operations. It can be adapted for use with wire line equipment and can be used to establish a mechanical connection with an object in the well bore and apply sufficient force to remove it.
• The tool includes an outer tubular body having an inner body structure disposed in movable relation therein. Telescoping movement of the inner and outer body structures causes the tool to selectively move into gripping relationship with the object. A catch mechanism having a locking position and an unlocking position secures the inner body structure about the outer body structure.
• The locking mechanism includes a pin structure that is selectively positioned within pin receiving grooves and a control spring that ensures the pin alternately enters one or the other of the unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly relative to one another. Unlocking can be achieved by downward movement of the control line tool followed by subsequent upward movement thereof.

• The present application claims priority to co-pending Mexico patent application Ser. Nos. MX/a/2011/005499 and MX/a/2010/005899.
• The invention relates to a method for the manufacture of composed stave floors, which includes providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm.
• The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means.
• The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means in the union plane; and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means, normal to the union plane.
• The invention aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic and functional properties in sight substrate of composed stave floors or engineering floors.
• The invention also aims to provide a sight substrate for composite stave compounds or engineering floors, without any trend to be deformed.
• The bonding means used in the invention prevent displacement or change of dimensions of the sheets.
• The invention provides floors with a major time of useful life and allows giving it corrective maintenance.
• The invention also provides improved composed stave floors, with applied glaze from the supplier, eliminating the time and the inconveniences of the application of the glaze in a period of the installation.
• The example embodiment was tested and showed no deformation or detachment, and it was possible to provide corrective maintenance, obtaining again the physical, aesthetic and functional properties of the original floor.

<summary>
• The invention describes a ladder attachment to improve lateral stability, prevent slipping, and avoid damaging the work surface.
• The attachment includes a brace with a flange and a U-bolt that secures to a ladder rung, and a resilient pad that contacts the work surface.
• The brace can be adjusted to fit different ladder sizes and can pivot horizontally to straddle corners.
• The attachment increases the contact area between the ladder and work surface, enhancing stability.
• The resilient pad grips the work surface without causing damage, and can resist both inward and outward forces.
• The design can be adapted to various ladder materials and sizes, and modifications are contemplated as falling within the scope of the invention.
</summary>

Original Text:

The present invention is directed to overcoming one or more of the problems set forth above. Briefly summarized, according to one aspect of the present invention, a brace for a ladder having first and second siderails connected by a rung comprises an extension arm having a flange on one end portion and an opening in the distal end portion. The flange has first and second openings. A U-bolt has its legs inserted through the first and second openings of the flange. The legs have threaded ends and are spaced to receive said ladder rung therebetween. First and second nuts are threadably mateable with the legs of the U-bolt to secure the flange to the U-bolt. A resilient pad assembly is pivotally connected to the extension arm.

It is an object of the present invention to provide a non-slip gripping portion for a ladder that grips the work surface without damaging the work surface.

Another object of the invention is to provide ladder which effectively increases the contact area of the ladder with the work surface.

Another object of the invention is to provide an attachment for a ladder to improve the lateral stability of the ladder.

Still another object of the present invention is to provide a ladder that can straddle a corner without losing stability.

These and other aspects, objects, features and advantages of the present invention will be more clearly understood and appreciated from a review of the following detailed description of the preferred embodiments and appended claims, and by reference to the accompanying drawings.

FIG.

<summary>

* The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool.
* Presently known collated nails are assembled using tape strips or an extruded plastic material, but these methods can create debris and shatter as the nails are driven into the workpiece.
* The invention aims to reduce debris and improve adhesion of the plastic to the nail shanks, while also minimizing the amount that the strip can flex.
* The collation system is configured to permit the collation to be coiled for use in driving tools that accept collations in this manner.
* The invention also includes a method for making a fastener assembly, which includes arranging a plurality of fasteners in a row, preheating the fasteners, molding a polymer material onto the preheated fasteners, and cooling the strip to form the fastener assembly.
* The fastener assembly can be configured to influence or encourage separation of the fasteners from one another at a desired location, reducing debris and impact on the connecting portion.

</summary>

The text describes a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. Presently known collated nails are assembled using tape strips or an extruded plastic material, but these methods can create debris and shatter as the nails are driven into the workpiece. The invention aims to reduce debris and improve adhesion of the plastic to the nail shanks, while also minimizing the amount that the strip can flex. The collation system is configured to permit the collation to be coiled for use in driving tools that accept collations in this manner. The invention also includes a method for making a fastener assembly, which includes arranging a plurality of fasteners in a row, preheating the fasteners, molding a polymer material onto the preheated fasteners, and cooling the strip to form the fastener assembly. The fastener assembly can be configured to influence or encourage separation of the fasteners from one another at a desired location, reducing debris and impact on the connecting portion.

<summary>

* The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants such as silicones in various industries like aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
* The nozzle has a bell or hood lower section and an injection button, and is designed for easy injection of sealants in multiple industrial applications.
* The bell-shaped tip facilitates the encapsulation of rivets or screws, particularly in the aeronautical industry.
* The injection button has a special design with channels and orifices for carrying out sealing operations with greater accuracy.
* The button allows the user to apply sealant operations both manually and by automated sealant injection machines.
* The nozzle is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene, and the bell-shaped section is sized to encapsulate rivets or nuts completely.
* The invention includes two embodiments, both having a main elongated hollow body, a hollow round and threaded section, and a bell or hood shaped section.
* The second embodiment has an injection button with lateral grooves or openings, allowing the sealant to be directed towards the walls of the orifice in which the screws are inserted.
* The nozzle provides a perfect seal from air and oxidizing liquids, and simplifies the sealing work in both aesthetic appearance and speed of execution.
* The nozzle reduces sealant application time, saves time and labor, provides a more economical sealing process, and increases the quality of the resulting sealant application.

</summary>

• The invention describes a position sensor that modifies an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer into a conditioned sensing signal by removing unneeded power and providing it to a remote monitor via two wires.
• A window reference circuit constantly compares a desired conditioned sensor signal output to an existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts the conditioned sensor signal output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal.
• An error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about a position of an object being sensed, wherein inclusion of the static and error signals would require energy.
• The error correction generator may include a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit for constantly comparing a value of the conditioned sensing signal to a desired minimum value and generates a correction signal that is subtracted from the offset and error signal to deliver a sensor signal output that is close to a desired minimum value.
• The signal processor may generate a relatively small reference signal that is large enough to eliminate small values of drift in a negative going direction yet is small enough not to generate a significant amount of signal due to a discrete nature of calibration voltages from a DAC and counter combination employed thereby.
• The error correction generator may generate a relatively large reference signal that substantially exceeds the largest voltage encountered by the sensor as an object being monitored moves its maximum amount, allowing rapid recalibration due to sudden changes in an offset voltage caused by rapid temperature or other changes.

• The document describes a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust function of a four-stroke piston in internal combustion engines, which aims to improve gas consumption and engine performance.
• The system eliminates the use of springs in the valve actuation process, reducing the force needed to accelerate the valves and increasing the engine's speed capabilities.
• The system uses a rotating cam that interacts with a translating means, which in turn reciprocates in a slot to achieve the first reciprocating linear movement. This movement controls the position of the valve, making it substantially infinitely variable in displacement.
• The system allows for precise control of the percentage of port opening in each piston separately or in unison, and the valve port can be closed indefinitely while the engine is still performing.
• The system can be computer-controlled, allowing for efficient and effective control of the engine's performance and gasoline consumption, regardless of the vehicle's speed or operating conditions.
• The system's design and curvatures are optimized for proper rise, fall, and dwell time, reducing landing click and improving engine performance.
• The system allows for variable displacement of any set of pistons, and computer control can enable operation of 2, 4, 6, or 8 pistons while keeping the engine running with minimal air/gasoline mixture.
• The system's simple and robust construction, along with its precise control, makes it an effective solution for improving engine performance and gasoline consumption in internal combustion engines.

<summary>

* The text describes an aquarium lighting system using LEDs with a housing having a top side and a bottom side, and a lighting control region on the bottom side.
* The lighting control region includes at least two control channels for controlling different colors of light, and a neutral channel, and is sized to receive one or more light-emitting modules.
* The system includes a switch coupled to the housing and operable to control one of the control channels.
* The light-emitting modules include an LED that emits a specific color of light and an electrical connector that couples to a control channel.
* The system allows for variable functionality and output options in a small and focused footprint, and enables an end user to define a color temperature output of the aquarium.
* The system can also be used for lighting underneath kitchen or office cabinets.

</summary>

Explanation:

* The text describes an aquarium lighting system that utilizes a housing with a top side and a bottom side, and a lighting control region on the bottom side of the housing.
* The lighting control region includes multiple control channels for controlling different colors of light, as well as a neutral channel. The lighting control region is sized to receive one or more light-emitting modules.
* The system includes a switch that is coupled to the housing and is operable to control one of the control channels. This allows for the user to manually adjust the lighting within the aquarium.
* The light-emitting modules include an LED that emits a specific color of light, as well as an electrical connector that couples to a control channel. This allows for the different colors of light to be controlled independently.
* The system is designed to be small and focused, allowing for a broad range of user functionality to be built into a simple, manually controllable design.
* Additionally, the system can also be used for lighting underneath kitchen or office cabinets, providing a versatile lighting solution.

<summary>

* The invention describes a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures.
* Prior art flow deflection apparatuses, such as stator or rotor blades in a gas turbine, are subjected to high ambient temperatures and require internal cooling channels to reduce metal temperature.
* The invention proposes using separate inserts for the separating walls, which are inserted into the apparatus and secured, instead of casting them together with the apparatus.
* This approach reduces the amount of material in the transitional region from the hot-gas wall to the separating wall, eliminates thermal stresses, reduces blade weight, and simplifies casting and cooling system adjustment.
* A first preferred embodiment features a hollow casting with integrally formed holders for the separating walls, while a second preferred embodiment connects the inserted separating walls to the flow deflection apparatus by an integral material joint.
* The separating walls may be straight or bent into a U-shape for deflecting the cooling fluid.
* The invention can be applied to various flow deflection apparatuses, including blades in a gas turbine, with cooling channels and separating walls extending in the radial direction.
* Figures 1-4 illustrate the prior art and exemplary embodiments of the invention in the form of a rotor blade for a gas turbine.
</summary>

1. The invention describes a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system, such as a throttle valve, in a vehicle. The system can be switched between manual and automatic control, allowing for smooth transitions without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall. When under manual control, the system provides full operation of the vehicle, and does not impair the safety of the driver or hamper the operation of the vehicle.
2. The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position. These signals are processed to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor, which automatically sets the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance. The control unit also provides an output signal that controls a clutch, connecting the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve when manual control is desired.
3. The control system can be used in conjunction with a system for controlling the operation of a continuously variable transmission, where manual control of the throttle valve position is desired at high transmission ratios, and automatic control is preferred at low transmission ratios. The control unit can be programmed to detect the transmission ratio and switch to the optimum control mode for the throttle.

• The invention is a method and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels such as wood waste.
• The invention aims to provide a clean burning waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate materials and operates with little slag or clinkers.
• The method forms a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, drying and gasifying the waste fuel.
• The volatile gases driven off the pile are partially oxidized in a first combustion chamber with less than stoichiometric proportions of combustion air, maintaining a lower temperature to prevent melting of natural ash, dirt, or other inorganic substances in the fuel.
• A flame holder in the primary combustion chamber forces volatile gases and any entrained particulate matter out to the walls, causing separation and fallback of entrained matter.
• The volatile gases move into a second combustion chamber where secondary combustion air is introduced for complete combustion.
• Combustion air introduced to the primary and secondary chambers is introduced on the outside of a refractory lining to cool the lining and increase its life.
• The secondary combustion air introduced in the secondary combustion chamber can be introduced at various axial locations to regulate the position of the flame within the chamber.
• Additional blend air can be added to the discharge of the secondary chamber to cool the air for industrial purposes other than boiler heat.
• The primary and secondary chambers can be added to any source of dirty particulate-laden combustible gas to burn the gas and remove the particulate for meeting environmental emission standards.

- The invention describes an evaporative cooler system that uses a heat exchanger to separate the evaporating water from the cooling air stream, achieving sensible cooling. The system draws at least a major portion of the working air from the room to be cooled, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than outside air, resulting in a larger temperature differential and more efficient cooling.
- The system includes various air flow paths, such as recirculation of return air to mix with fresh air for quicker cooling at a higher energy cost, and bypass of cooled air to mix with working return air for lower temperature but higher energy cost. The heat exchanger comprises an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members, with the wet side accomplished by gravity flow of water downwardly along the inner surfaces of the tubes in conjunction with countercurrent flow of returned air from the load, and the dry side accomplished by fresh air flowing in thermal conductive contact with the outer surfaces of the tubular members for cooling.

<summary>

* This application claims the benefit of U.S. patent application 62/055,020, filed Sep. 25, 2014.
* The application relates to pumps for pumping fluids, specifically for pumping liquid manure from a reservoir in high volumetric flow rate and high pressure.
* A first pump head comprises a first housing containing a first impeller configured to move fluid through at least three first conduits in fluid communication with the first housing.
* A second pump head comprises a second housing containing a second impeller configured to move fluid through at least three second conduits in fluid communication with the second housing.
* The at least three second conduits are in fluid communication with an inlet into the first housing along a fluid flow path between the first and second pump heads.
* A drive structure passes through the inlet between the first and second pump heads, and is configured to commonly drive the first and second impellers.
* The fluid pump cannot be constructed by simply stacking known pumps together, and the intermediate pump heads have design features to permit series flow of fluid and common driving of the impellers.
</summary>

<summary>
	• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes, specifically for less than all engine cylinders.
	• Traditional systems include an engine brake for each cylinder, but this results in excess components when not all cylinders are needed for maximum braking horsepower.
	• The invention includes an engine with a reduced number of engine compression release brakes, attached to a portion of the engine cylinders.
	• The engine housing defines a plurality of engine cylinders, and each engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve.
	• The engine compression release brake system improves overall engine robustness by reducing the number of components.
	• The engine compression release brake is activated during the compression stroke of the piston, opening the exhaust valve and releasing compression.
	• The engine brake includes a brake body, an electrical actuator (such as a solenoid), a valve member, a spool valve member, and a piston.
	• The spool valve member is biased toward its retracted position and can move to an advanced position when pressure communication passage is fluidly connected to low pressure reservoir.
	• The piston is movably positioned in the brake body and provides a hydraulic surface exposed to fluid pressure in actuation fluid passage. When actuation fluid passage is open to high pressure passage, high pressure acts on the hydraulic surface to move the piston downward, causing the exhaust valve actuator to move to an open position.
	</summary>

• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox.
• Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes must withstand various loads, including those from blade-off events, which are unpredictable and can be much stronger than other sudden or extreme shocks.
• The mounting link includes a male link and a female link that can translate relative to each other to form a radial interface, which dampens translation of the male link relative to the female link.
• A pin releasably couples the male link and the female link to selectively retain them.
• In case of extreme loads, the pin can shear, allowing a permitted range of motion between the engine and the gearbox.
• The female link includes a link mounting end and a link interface end with a cavity to receive the male link.
• The male link includes a link mounting end and a link interface end that is received by the female link.
• The pin passes through through holes in the female and male links to engage and retain them.
• After the pin shears, the female link and the male link are allowed to translate relative to each other, which can limit or prevent damage to the gearbox and its attached peripherals.
• The coulomb damping provided by the radial interface between the female link and the male link dissipates energy created by the translation.

<summary>

- The invention describes an archery equipment that includes a point cap, point adaptor, nock cap, and balance pin. The point cap and point adaptor have external and internal threads, respectively, for attaching arrow points to arrow shafts. The nock cap is used to attach nocks to the end of an arrow shaft, and the balance pin is used to balance the arrow shaft by adjusting the point weight.
- The point cap and point adaptor are made of hardened steel and light material such as aluminum, respectively. They are adhesively attached to the arrow shaft to provide additional support and prevent damage to the threads. The nock cap is also adhesively attached to the arrow shaft and provides fluid communication between its ends.
- The balance pin is made of a heavy, soft metal such as brass and is inserted into the arrow shaft without the use of a threaded arrow shaft. The head portion of the balance pin is bonded to the interior of the arrow point or point cap by adhesive, and the shaft of the balance pin is trimmed to obtain a desired point weight. The balance pin can also be used with the point cap by affixing the head portion in the bore of the ferrule end of the point cap, which is then attached to the arrow shaft.
</summary>

• The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training.
• It utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system, and can be installed in a firing unit which can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
• The SAFES produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion produced in a manner which utilizes the weapon's ejection port.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt.
• The SAFES is designed to provide a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, and an inexpensive means to provide realistic training using an actual weapon.
• It is also designed to be a reliable, low maintenance, reusable small arms training device, and a pyrotechnic simulation of small arms fire without dangerous pressuration of the ignition chamber.

• The present invention is an air intake device for an internal combustion engine, comprising a tank, a first pipe with a larger cross-sectional area, and a second pipe with a smaller cross-sectional area, both interconnecting the tank and the air intake passage at different locations. A valve and valve actuating means are also included in the first passage.
• The device aims to improve engine performance by utilizing the dynamic effect of air flow and reducing noise from the air intake. The cross-sectional area of the second passage is preferably smaller than one-tenth that of the first passage, and it opens to the air intake passage nearer the air cleaner than the first passage.
• The control valve is actuated by an actuator with a diaphragm, vacuum chamber, compressed spring, and a solenoid valve controlled by a controller based on engine load conditions. The controller produces a control signal for the solenoid valve, which in turn controls the valve to open or close.
• The valve is preferably closed when the engine load is below a specific line and opened only in the region where the load is above the line and the speed is above a certain value. This operating condition can be stored as a map in the control circuit, which produces a control signal for the solenoid valve and thus the control valve.

• The invention describes a two-part bracket system for mounting speakers or other equipment to various surfaces or structures. The system comprises a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket. The adjustable bracket can be attached to the object to be mounted and then positioned on the stationary bracket to mount the object on the surface or pole. The system is designed for one person to install and is resistant to weather, wind, and vibration.

• The system includes a pole clamp assembly for use on poles and the like. The pole clamp assembly consists of adapter brackets with stepped teeth that fit onto cylinders and a link chain with threaded J-hooks or hooked rods at each end. The J-hooks pass through aligned slotted openings in the stationary bracket and pole adapters, and wing nuts provide the means to easily tension the chain without the need for tools. This combination of components fits a wide variety of pole shapes and sizes, produces excellent resistance to rotation, and reduces the likelihood of over tensioning.

<summary>
 
* The text describes a modular burner system for heat-utilizing appliances, with a burner that can be used with various appliances such as cookers, grills, food smokers, space heaters, and pyrolyzers.
* The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall, with air flowing both through and around the fuel holder to support primary, secondary, and tertiary combustion. A shroud surrounds the outer wall to provide a flow path for tertiary combustion air and to provide a cool exterior surface.
* The burner also has legs for stability, an ash pan for collecting ash and storing water, and a cover to prevent inadvertent ingress of objects and exposure to heat and exhaust fumes.
* The system includes a coupling for detachably connecting a modular heat-utilizing appliance to the burner, and the appliances themselves, which can include closed or open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer.
* The pyrolyzer is designed for pyrolyzing carboniferous materials and includes a heating chamber, a tightly fitting cap, and a condenser for condensing vaporized liquid products of pyrolysis.
</summary>

<summary>

- The invention aims to improve combustion efficiency and cooling characteristics in rotary internal combustion engines, minimizing the risk of structural failure in the engine housing.
- The invention features a housing structure that facilitates circumferential cooling flow while allowing spark plug bosses to be inserted, with minimal thermal distortion in the zone surrounding the spark plug bosses.
- A peripheral cooling circuit is defined in the housing, providing separate flow paths for releasing boiling vapor from multiple spark plug bosses interrupting the circuit.
- The housing structure is designed to increase the heat transfer coefficient of the cooling circuit at the spark plug boss zone by at least 20% over prior art capabilities.
- Plug bosses are interposed in a circumferential cooling flow passageway of the rotor housing, staggered with respect to the direction of flow, promoting a relatively close in-line arrangement of the spark plug terminals.
- A predetermined and limited offset from a line extending between the spark plug terminals ensures adequate propagation of the combustion flame and allows for the staggered boss configuration.
- Flow diverters or controllers between the spark plug bosses ensure a controlled flow regime between the bosses and strengthen the housing structure.
- Experiments show that staggered spark plug bosses can increase the heat transfer coefficient by as much as 44% compared to in-line arrangements, leading to improved cooling performance.

</summary>

• The invention describes a method for minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
• The method uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves, which in turn maintains constant steam generator pressure and minimizes turbine power changes.
• The flow difference between the N and N-1 condition is determined during the turbine design process and applied to the total flow demand to each of the N-1 valves on the basis of the total N valve demand derived from the position of the valve under test.
• The method does not require the monitoring of additional process parameters, resulting in improved performance.
• The use of the control valve test compensating control of the present invention reduced the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main (throttle) steam pressure by 95%.

• The invention is a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two inlets and one outlet, allowing for a solution mixture ranging from 0% of one fluid to 100% of the other fluid.
• The system uses a spool valve with a series of cylindrical spools and channels to direct the flow of fluids.
• A flow restricting device is used to reduce the flow rate of one of the fluids.
• The valve is adjustable to allow for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of the two fluids.
• The design includes mechanisms to maintain constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages.
• The system is intended for use in the commercial airline industry for extensive aircraft cleaning tasks.
• The valve system allows for multiple identical valve systems to operate from a common soap solution source and common water source without adversely affecting the fluid pressure required by each user.

- The invention describes a method and arrangement for compressing and cooling natural gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and feeding it back into the pipeline at a lower temperature and increased pressure. The arrangement includes a compressor, heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, and control units. The present invention proposes compressing the gas to an excess pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure to obtain further cooling. This method reduces investments and operation risk as it eliminates the need for expensive re-cooling plants used during warm weather periods.
- The invention utilizes the physical effect that a compressed gas is inevitably cooled when expanded to a lower pressure. During the warmer period of the year, the gas is compressed to an excess pressure, cooled by heat exchange, and then expanded to the desired exit pressure. The excess pressure is selected so that cooling during expansion is sufficient for obtaining a temperature reduction to the desired exit temperature for the re-entry into the gas pipeline. The expansion can be carried out by a valve or an expansion turbine, which recovers mechanical energy and utilizes it for providing a portion of the drive energy for the compression of the gas to the intended excess pressure.
- A particularly advantageous embodiment of the present invention provides that the compression to the excess pressure is carried out in a total of three stages. A predominant portion of the compression takes place in two successive primary compression stages, which are equipped with machines producing approximately the same pressure ratio. The gas heated in the first primary compression stage is cooled preferably by air/gas heat exchange between the two primary compression stages. The desired excess pressure is reached in an additional compression stage, which includes a booster compressor. Subsequently, the gas is again cooled, preferably by means of an air/gas heat exchange, and expanded in an expansion turbine. The latter is coupled mechanically to the booster compressor of the additional compression stage and is the sole drive means for the booster compressor, so that a significant portion of the total drive energy required for producing the excess pressure can be recovered.
- The invention provides an overall better possibility of using the principal units of the compressor stations throughout the entire year, as compared to the prior art in which special re-cooling

<summary>
 
* The text describes a cooling fan assembly for forced air cooling in various applications, such as computers or heat-generating systems.
* The fan assembly includes a motor with a shaft to rotate a fan blade, and may include motor control components.
* The assembly is mounted to a panel using a motor carrier with mounting legs, each having a resilient leg portion and a turned-out portion.
* The panel has recess portions that correspond to the mounting legs, with an opening including an enlarged and residual opening region.
* Spring members urge the motor carrier away from the panel, preventing it from moving and becoming disengaged during operation.
* The installation process involves positioning the assembly against the panel, applying a compressive and rotating force, and securing it in the fully installed position.
* The text also notes potential modifications or variations to the described embodiment.
</summary>

<summary>

- Spacecraft structures using lightweight composites have low damping, leading to high vibration levels that can compromise functionality of instruments mounted on precision kinematic mounts (KM), which have little inherent damping.

<summary>

* The invention is a novel and improved clutch unit, particularly for large size power transmission requirements, that overcomes disadvantages of previously known constructions.
* It is capable of applying strong coupling forces between the plates and discs while maintaining high control accuracy and utilizing hydraulic fluid for cooling and reducing residual drag.
* The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, an output shaft, a plurality of clutch plates, a plurality of clutch discs, and separate means for closing the gap between each clutch disc and its adjacent clutch plates.
* The clutch discs are made up of arcuate segments in a circumferential arrangement, allowing for easier fabrication using conventional retort equipment.
</summary>

The patent describes a clutch unit used in a stored energy rotary drive aircraft catapult system. The clutch unit is designed to transmit high horsepowers and minimize residual drag, which is a significant problem in large size clutch units. The invention utilizes a novel design with separate piston and cylinder means for each set of clutch disc segments and clutch plates, allowing for full force to be applied on all portions of the assembly and maximum torque transmission. The clutch discs are made up of arcuate segments, allowing for easier fabrication using conventional retort equipment. The system also utilizes hydraulic fluid for cooling and reducing residual drag.

<summary>
• The text describes an engine system that includes combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders, with the expansion cylinders being larger in displacement than the combustion cylinders. The expansion cylinders are driven by the exhaust gases from the combustion cylinders, and water is injected into the system to aid in cooling and increasing the temperature of the injected water environment to produce additional steam.
• The system aims to reduce the exhaust gas and water from the most downstream cascade cylinder to such an extent that no radiator may be necessary. This is achieved by capturing and transferring the heat from the combustion cylinder to the cascade cylinders, which increases the temperature of the injected water environment to produce additional steam and allows the recapture of this heat energy.
• The system includes a water recovery system that ensures that the source of water will be largely recycled, and that an unduly large water tank will not be necessary. The expansion cylinders may be provided in sufficient numbers, such that the final exhaust may be brought to a low temperature, say below 500° F., and in a preferred embodiment, at or below 212° F.
</summary>

1. The invention provides a plate with a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer in contact with the substrate, topped by a metal alloy layer. A portion of the metal alloy layer is removed from at least one precoated face of the plate.
2. The precoat is preferably an alloy of aluminum or based on aluminum, and the metal alloy layer preferably comprises silicon, iron, and aluminum.
3. The area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is preferably produced by partly eliminating the metal alloy layer on at least one precoated face of the plate by brushing or using a laser beam.
4. The invention also provides a welded blank obtained by butt-welding at least two plates according to the invention, and a part obtained by heat treatment and deformation of a welded blank according to the invention.
5. The plate, blank, or part according to the invention can be used for the fabrication of structural or safety parts for motorized terrestrial automotive vehicles.

<summary>

* The present invention is a remote control system for a mobile structure that optimally recovers energy from an offshore marine environment.
* The system is a continuation of U.S. patent application Ser. No. 11/942,576, and the contents of this application are incorporated by reference.
* The system includes a Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) system that remotely controls the operation and navigation of the mobile structure.
* The SCADA system gathers data from various sources, including GPS systems, weather satellite systems, and geographic and weather data resources.
* The SCADA system includes computer servers that run Human Machine Interface (HMI) secure software applications and communicate with microprocessor systems on the mobile structure.
* The system is not limited to the implementation of the Turbine-Integrated Hydrofoil system of U.S. Pat. No. 7,298,056, and can be used with any system that exploits energy from weather patterns.
* The system includes an algorithm that optimizes energy extraction using yield functions derived from weather and geospatial data and vessel performance models.
* The system can also be used for logistics-only purposes, guiding navigation of vessels past weather patterns without weighing energy extraction yield factors into the cost of travel.
* The system includes various components such as mobile structures, central service facilities, communication systems, and control and communications microprocessor systems.
</summary>

Note: The above summary is a general overview of the patent application and does not include all the details and specifics of the invention. It is recommended to read the full patent application for a complete understanding of the invention.

<summary>

* The invention describes a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures for rolling bodies arranged in succession in the circumferential direction.
* The ring element is manufactured from a sheet metal material with an axial profiling formed by forming techniques.
* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined in succession in the circumferential direction and connected, in particular welded, in a production step before the formation of the axial profiling.
* The flat material ring segments are put together across an engagement zone and welded along edge regions facing each other.
* The joint contours form an undercut geometry that preliminarily couples the ring elements in the circumferential direction.
* The flat material ring segments are preferably punched out from a sheet metal material as 120° ring segments, reducing cutting waste and requiring only three weld points for joining together a ring element.
* The concept is suitable for the manufacture of radial and axial bearing cages, particularly for groove and angular ball bearings.
* The method for manufacturing a rolling body guide cage involves composing the ring element from at least two flat material ring segments before the forming step.
* The flat material ring segments are welded in the region of a joint formed by these flat material ring segments.
* The weld point can be formed by laser welding or pressure welding, with the option of adding welding material.
</summary>

The invention focuses on reducing production costs for rolling body guide cages by introducing a new design and manufacturing method. The proposed design consists of a ring element made from at least two flat material ring segments joined in succession in the circumferential direction. These segments are connected via joints that form engagement zones with positively interlocking joint contours, creating an undercut geometry for preliminary coupling. The segments are punched out from a sheet metal material, preferably as 120° ring segments, minimizing cutting waste and requiring only three weld points for joining together a ring element.

This design is suitable for manufacturing radial and axial bearing cages, particularly for groove and angular ball bearings. The method for manufacturing a rolling body guide cage involves composing the ring element from at least two flat material ring segments before the forming step.
