- The text describes methods and systems for obtaining and processing information related to customer service locations in a telecommunications network. This includes using global satellite positioning (GPS) to acquire latitude and longitude coordinates of service locations, and storing this information in databases associated with customer records and address guides. 
- The text also discusses methods and systems for generating driving directions between customer service locations, using GPS to obtain coordinates and a mapping system to generate the directions. The systems and methods aim to improve customer service response time and efficiency by providing accurate and specific location information.

<summary>

* The invention is a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, specifically for magnetic field compensation using two sensors and a digital processor.
* The system is an improvement on feedback control systems that use one or more sensors to measure the amplitude of interfering fields and calculate control signals for devices generating magnetic fields.
* Magnetic field compensation systems are used in imaging systems such as scanning electron microscopes (SEM) to compensate for the terrestrial magnetic field or fields generated by other current-carrying devices.
* Pairs of Helmholtz coils are commonly used to generate homogeneous compensation fields, with one pair for each of the three space axes forming a cube-shaped cage around the location of interest.
* A device for compensating magnetic fields is disclosed in U.S. Publication No 2005/019555A1, using three coil pairs in a cage and an analog controller.
* Systems are also available that use only one coil per space axis for generating the compensation field, but the compensation region is smaller than with Helmholtz coils.
* Generally, a single magnetic field sensor is used for measuring the magnetic field at the place of interest, but this does not allow for detecting whether the magnetic field is homogeneous or inhomogeneous.
* It is difficult to measure interfering fields directly at the location of interest, as the object to be protected is usually there.
* Undesired feedback effects may occur when two magnetic field compensation systems are arranged directly adjacent to one another.
* Control systems for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields can generally be optimized for single applications, but adjusting to different control tasks is difficult or impossible.

</summary>

- The invention describes a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy, where at least one resonance site is furnished in the sample by a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure with at least one reaction partner. This allows for the detection of specific chemical structures or bonds in the sample that were not previously detectable by CARS microscopy.
- The invention also discusses the use of bioorthogonal reactions, which are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes, to equip a sample with resonance sites. This can be useful for increasing the CARS-active scattering cross section of a target or for generating it in the first place through suitable synthesis reactions. The use of bioorthogonal reactions in combination with CARS microscopy also allows for dedicated detection of target sites in any samples, such as cells, without negatively affecting biochemical processes.

<summary>

* The source document describes a system for assessing segmentations in radiation therapy.
* The system compares volume models generated from segmentations to identify missing or extra volume elements.
* The comparison can be used for training clinicians, quality assurance of autosegmentation routines, and evaluating new imaging technology.
* The system can also assess whether a new treatment plan is needed based on changes in the patient's internal anatomy.
* The system uses electronic files in the DICOM-RT standard to record segmentations and compare them.
* The system can display the results of the comparison using different colors to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements.
* The system can also display the results superimposed on a cross-sectional image of patient tissue.
* The system uses a metric method to measure the conformance between the segmentations, which can be customized by the user.
* The system can also provide a histogram showing cumulative missing and extra volume elements as a function of distance ranges.
</summary>

The source document describes a system for assessing segmentations in radiation therapy. The system compares volume models generated from segmentations to identify missing or extra volume elements. This comparison can be used for training clinicians, quality assurance of autosegmentation routines, and evaluating new imaging technology. The system can also assess whether a new treatment plan is needed based on changes in the patient's internal anatomy.

The system uses electronic files in the DICOM-RT standard to record segmentations and compare them. The system can display the results of the comparison using different colors to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements. The system can also display the results superimposed on a cross-sectional image of patient tissue.

The system uses a metric method to measure the conformance between the segmentations, which can be customized by the user. The metric method can be a combination of constant, linear, and exponential functions. The system can also provide a histogram showing cumulative missing and extra volume elements as a function of distance ranges.

The system includes a graphic display screen and a user input device for accepting a representation of the metric method to allow a user to set the metric method. The system can also display a graphical representation of the metric method to assist in development of custom metric methods.

* The text describes a patent for an improved data processing system with a focus on accelerating the execution of floating point operations, specifically the effective subtraction operation.
* The invention involves determining the difference between a subset of the operand exponent arguments before the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments is available.
* This subset difference is used to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions (or fractional portions thereof) and choose procedures such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset operand argument difference, the correct result fraction is available.
* The text outlines two procedures for accelerating the effective subtraction operation, depending on whether the absolute difference in the arguments of the exponents of the two operands is less than or greater than one.
* The apparatus implementing the procedures includes a subtraction unit, detection and logic unit, shift and selection logic unit, and selection logic unit.
* The output signals from these units are applied to subtraction and selection logic units to determine the final fraction result.
* The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by calculating a difference between a subset of signal positions of an operand exponent argument and initiating the operation requiring a calculation prior to the determination of the difference between the complete operand arguments.

• The present invention is a method and system for tracking a specimen acquired from a patient, designed to reduce or avoid mislabeling of specimen vials.
• The method includes storing machine-readable codes related to the patient, order, specimen-taker, and specimen container, and generating signals to acquire a specimen and place it in the container.
• The system includes a standalone or networked computer, computer storage, and an electronic reading means for reading unique machine-readable codes on ID means, orders, specimen-takers, and containers.
• The computer processor determines if the patient and order are related, and if the specimen container is out-of-date, and generates alerts as needed.
• The method includes generating a barcode for the patient at registration, and storing patient information in a relational manner with the patient's barcode number in the computer storage.
• The method includes generating a unique order barcode number and storing it in a relational manner with the patient's information and barcode number in the computer storage.
• The system includes a barcode scanner for reading machine-readable codes and communicating them to the computer processor, which stores the codes in the computer storage and generates signals as needed.

• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device, such as for golf, that uses GPS technology and voice recognition technology to provide distance and other information to the user in a verbal, electronically spoken form.
• The electronics and software for the device can be incorporated into an article of clothing or other portable device, such as a hat or visor. The device can also use other distance measuring technologies like infra-red, optics, or Doppler acoustics.
• The device uses commercially available golf course mapping data to convert GPS longitude and latitude coordinates to measure distance and other factors.
• The device incorporates voice recognition technology to accept voice commands from the user and voice synthesis technology to provide an audible output of distance and other information to the user via a loudspeaker or headphone.
• The device can also accept verbal or other data input and memorize and compute this to predict golf course user golf strategy, club selection, rules and other golf player needs.
• The device can be used for other applications beyond golf, such as hiking, surveying, hunting, scuba diving, and portable computing. The device can also be connected to a separate personal computer for various detailed functions, such as graphical display of the user's score and plot of all ball trajectories, display of clubs used, expert system advice, printing of results and scorecards, and uploading of new course databases.

<summary>

* The present invention is a design rule checking system and method for accurately reporting errors in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic.
* The invention eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the design rule-checking tool.
* The method checks whether the logic part of a mask pattern data obeys logic rules and the memory part obeys memory rules, which are modified appropriately for a memory area to accommodate the more liberal values available for such regions.
* Customized rules are created for different types of memory regions based on modifying a standard logic rule by "pushing" more liberal memory based parameter on to a stricter logic based parameter.
* A program can be executed on any number of conventional computing systems for creating such customized rules and for performing a design rule check on mask pattern data based on such customized rule sets.
* The results are categorized in different categories in accordance with where they occur, such as in Logic, Bordered Single Port (BDSP) SRAM, Borderless Single Port (BLSP) SRAM, Dual Port (DP) SRAM and ROM groups.
* The invention should find significant usage in the semiconductor industry and similar industries where different design rules must be applied to different types of regions on a substrate.

</summary>

• The invention is related to the use of waveguide holograms (WGH) for controlled illumination of objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators (SLMs).
• The WGHs are based on thin substrate waveguides, which are optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser. These waveguides are characterized by the relationship between the width w of an incident laser beam coupled onto an optical waveguide having a thickness t, controlled by λ, the wavelength of the incident lightwave.
• Thin substrate waveguides are characterized by t>>λ, which allows for convenient white light illumination and uniform illumination, avoiding difficulties encountered in coupling the optical source to the thin film waveguide.
• The WGHs can be used to selectively illuminate demanding objects, such as holograms and SLMs, by compensating for non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront in the direction of propagation through exposing a photographic emulsion to the beam without compensation or recording the hologram of the WGH hologram illuminator non-uniformly.
• The WGH illuminator occupies much less space compared to a conventional lens illumination system and can achieve very high diffraction efficiency, while minimizing noise and making viewers comfortable due to the absence of stray light propagating forward the observer.
• However, there are some penalties to be paid, such as the need for critical alignment of the laser beam, time delay across the hologram, and the need for temporal coherence of the source exceeding the time delay. Additionally, nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction, two-sidedness, and light dispersion can also be issues.

- The invention describes a method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors. The apparatus includes a test head with an exciting means to magnetize the rotor, voltage sensing means to generate a voltage signal responsive to the magnetic flux variations, current sensing means to sense the magnitude of the alternating current utilized to magnetize the rotor, and processing means to determine the resistance and reactance of the rotor.
- The apparatus may also include skew sensing means to sense the effective electrical skew of the rotor and determine an effective electrical skew of the rotor responsive to the effective skew signal. The test apparatus provides automatic pass/fail determinations, measurement of resistance, reactance and skew, and detailed statistical comparison and evaluation of the measurement results, as well as automatic identification of defective rotors.
- The test heads of the test fixtures have a unique construction, comprising a structure utilizing a core of magnetic material very similar to a conventional dynamoelectric machine stator. The test head includes a set of primary windings which form at least one pair of poles, and these primary windings form the exciting current carrying winding for the test head which, when an alternating current is supplied during a rotor test, creates an alternating magnetic field in a center cylindrical cavity.
- The test fixture structure comprises a test head and the retraction and drive mechanism. The retraction and drive mechanism functions to retract and rotate the rotor within the test head in response to activation of a start button. The test fixture is coupled to a data acquisition, processing and control system which controls testing and acquires data from each test head independently. The system automatically performs the rotor test on the respective test fixture, controls the rotation of the rotor within the fixture, the acquisition of data via the fixture, and the processing of the acquired data without further operator intervention.

<summary>

* The source document describes a method for securing a computing device by granting access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library, and denying access to a managed application that includes a digital certificate authorizing it to access a specific native resource of the operating system through the managed library.
* The method involves using a manager to restrict the third party application's access to resources other than those provided by one or more select libraries, and dynamically loading a managed library at runtime depending on what dependencies are required for the managed application.
* The arbitration layer includes a runtime host that calls methods of the operating system to implement the requests of the application.
* The title player loads and authenticates the runtime host, manager, managed library, and managed application prior to execution to ensure that they had not been tampered with.
* The title player checks the authenticity of the assembly and if it is legitimate, it checks the certificate to determine what privileges should be granted to it, and obtains a set of privileges to enforce by selectively granting or denying a managed application's access requests to certain managed libraries.
</summary>

1. The invention describes an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers. This design aims to protect the electronic components from damage caused by bending stresses and external forces.
2. The card comprises a core layer made of silica-filled polyolefin, at least one antenna, at least one computer chip electrically connected to the antenna, a bottom sheet attached to the core layer, an alkyd resin spid containing an anti-binding agent printed on the core layer, and two laminate layers encasing the core and bottom sheet.
3. The card's manufacturing process includes pre-shrinking a core layer, printing indicia on one side, and attaching antennae and IC chips to the other side. The core layer is then bonded to a bottom sheet with an adhesive layer, and two polymer layers are affixed to the bonded core layer/bottom layer structure to provide mechanical strength and protect the image-receiving layer.

<summary>

* The invention describes a method for implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory using a tree-shaped data structure.
* The nodes in the tree have a maximum size, and additions to the queue are directed to the first non-full node on the first edge of the tree.
* Deletions from the queue are directed to a leaf node on the edge of the tree, typically on the opposite edge.
* The tree-shaped data structure allows for faster and less space-consuming updates, as only the path leading from the root to the point of updating must be copied.
* A header node can be added to the data structure to further improve update speed and reduce space consumption.
* The header node includes a bit to indicate the direction of the queue, allowing for constant-time inversion of the queue.
* The queue can also be used as a double-ended queue, with additions and deletions made from both ends.
* The bit indicating the direction of the queue can also be added to individual nodes in the tree in the basic embodiment of the invention.
* The memory arrangement includes an actual memory, intermediate registers, control logic, a flag register, an input register, and an output register.
* The maximum size of the nodes in the tree is not necessarily fixed and can follow a pattern, such as having level-specific maximum sizes.

</summary>

- The invention provides methods to build embedded EPROM devices using existing IC manufacture technologies, including EPROM devices for DRAM redundancy circuits using existing DRAM technology and EPROM devices manufactured by standard logic technologies that do not require high voltages for operations.
- The invention utilizes existing circuit elements to build EPROM devices without complicating existing manufacture technologies, such as using DRAM storage capacitors as the coupling capacitors to build floating gate EPROM devices and utilizing transistor properties changed under stress conditions to support EPROM operations.

• The invention describes a technique for determining the optimum value of feedback gain used in feedback control for calculating correction amount.
• Feedback control is commonly used in systems like automatic guidance vehicles to keep them on a predetermined course.
• The feedback gain can be calculated using P, PI, PD, or PID systems, where P, I, and D are feedback gains representing proportional, integral, and differential control respectively.
• The invention proposes a method for determining the feedback gain that involves repeatedly executing feedback control with a provisionally determined feedback gain, detecting errors, calculating an evaluation value based on the error, and adjusting the feedback gain accordingly.
• The evaluation value is calculated differently depending on whether the proportional, integral, or differential gain is being determined.
• The method can be used for various systems, including automatic guidance vehicles, and can quickly and accurately determine the feedback gain that provides suitable control characteristics.
• The invention can be applied to feedback gain systems other than P, I, and D gains, and the order of determining the optimum values can be changed.

• The invention describes a zoom lens with a high relative aperture, good optical performance, and reduced size, suitable for photographic cameras or video cameras.
• The zoom lens has a complex structure, including five lens units with specific properties and arrangements.
• The lens units are designed to satisfy certain conditions that ensure good correction of aberrations and high image quality.
• The invention allows for a significant reduction of the total length of the lens to as short as 9.13φ A to 9.19φ A, which is a great advance in lens size reduction.

* This text describes a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, or photons, in a detector.
* A charge pulse is generated in the detector when a particle passes through it, and this pulse is converted into an electric signal and indicated or recorded.
* The method and device can detect individual particles and their sequences or pulses over time, as well as integrate particles when the count rate or signal rate exceeds a given threshold value to maintain an averaged result over an extended period of time.
* The method involves discharging a charge pulse or signal from the detector on the low-voltage side, which allows for the detection of small-size signals and prevents the detection of leakage current in a high-voltage cable.
* The device includes a detector, at least one consecutively arranged amplification device, and optionally a display and/or recording device. The amplification device includes a first, fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals and a second, slow amplifier for integrating signals.
* The method and device can be used in a variety of applications, including particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices such as X-ray devices and CT devices, and electrical power engineering applications.
* The text also discusses the use of a converter material to detect uncharged particles and the use of a material enabling fast charge transport at room temperature, such as diamond, as the detector material.
* Figures and detailed descriptions of preferred embodiments are provided to illustrate the method and device.

• The invention is a gauging fixture for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.
• The apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary and movable ring, a torque motor, and a hub for mounting the driven disc assembly.
• The movable ring is moved toward the stationary ring to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly, and the torque motor applies a predetermined torque to the assembly.
• The distance between the rings is measured before and after the torque is applied, and the difference is compared with a standard value to determine if the assembly is excessively warped.
• The apparatus operates automatically, without manual involvement by an operator, and generates an external indication of whether the assembly is good or bad.
• The apparatus includes a base, end plates, a top plate, shafts, and a pair of rings.
• The right ring is connected to a support plate, which is journalled for sliding movement on the shafts, and the left ring is secured to the left end plate.
• A torque motor, spindle, and splined hub are provided for mounting the driven disc assembly, and a servo motor is used to move the right ring.
• An electronic position sensor and target are used to measure the distance between the rings, and a torque motor is used to apply a predetermined torque to the driven disc assembly.

• The document describes a face age-estimation system and method that use a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract feature vectors from face images.
• The CAM algorithm is used to generate a statistical model of appearance that combines a modified active shape model (MASM) and a quasi-localized texture model.
• The MASM represents the facial structure, while the texture model represents the pattern of contourlet-based intensities (skin texture) across a facial image patch.
• The CAM algorithm is robust against noise and can extract more robust facial features that encode age information compared to other facial feature extraction methods.
• The feature vectors are used to train an age classifier and two aging functions using support vector regression (SVR) and support vector machines (SVMs).
• The age classifier is capable of distinguishing between youths and adults, while the aging functions model the growth and development of young people and the aging of adults.
• In the testing phase, the CAM algorithm is used to extract a feature vector from a test image, which is then used by the age classifier to determine whether the individual is a youth or an adult.
• An appropriate aging function is then used to estimate the age of the individual, and the estimated age is provided in the form of a single age or age indicator with a corresponding confidence factor.
• The system and method can be implemented on a computing system with a processor, memory, storage device, input device, and network interface device.

• The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, aiming to best preserve the definition of the image with higher definition.
• The device includes a controller for producing display light intensity signals for each pixel, and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements of a predetermined number of pixels.
• Each arrangement has pixels dedicated to the display of a first image and receive the light intensity signals associated with the pixels of the first image, and one or more other pixels dedicated to the display of a second image and receiving light intensity signals associated with the pixels of the second image.
• The merged display of the first and second images is produced, with the images being redimensioned by scaling means if necessary.
• The pixels dedicated to the display of the first image can emit a first single color, and the pixels dedicated to the display of the second image can emit a second single color different from the first color.
• The controller can apply attenuation functions to the light intensity signals to be applied to the pixels, depending on the quantified light intensity signal value of the remaining pixels in the arrangement.

• The invention describes a mobile identification transmitter that can activate a security system of a motor vehicle and serve as a payment element for electronic payment systems. The payment element can be removed from the housing of the identification transmitter and used for payment actions.

• The identification transmitter has a receptacle in which the payment element is inserted. The receptacle can have contact elements that connect with the payment element when it is in the normal state. A closure can protect the contact elements from the external environment in the secure state.

• The payment element can have its own communication means for communication with the payment system, or the communication means of the identification transmitter can serve the purpose of communication with the payment system.

• An energy storage device can supply the electronics and/or the payment element with current. The closure can be designed as a dummy plug that is fastened to a cable of the housing.

• The communication means of the payment element can work in a frequency range of approx. 13.56 MHz and communicate with the payment system cryptographically. The communication means can have a range of less than 20 cm, particularly less than 10 cm.

• The text describes an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, that becomes inactive when not in use and enters sleep mode to save energy.
• The toner used in the device is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge, and a toner concentration (TC) sensor measures the concentration of the toner by detecting the tribo charge.
• If the device is inactive for a long time, the tribo charge of the toner may decrease, affecting image quality.
• The text describes methods and an apparatus for charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the period of inactivity.
• The charging method may include determining the periods of inactivity, measuring the toner charge level when the device recovers from inactivity, and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the difference between the measured charge and a predetermined level.
• The apparatus includes an inactivity determining section and a charging section that charges the toner to a predetermined level.
• The above-described method and apparatus may be included in a xerographic machine.
• The text also describes the structure of an exemplary printing device, including a photoreceptor belt, charging station, imaging and exposure station, developer station, transfer station, fusing station, and cleaning station.
• The text also discusses how the tribo charge of toner is adjusted using an intelligent toner charging system, which includes a controller with an inactivity determining section, predicting section, measuring section, calculating section, updating section, and storing section.

This is achieved by providing a control signal generator for generating control signals for controlling the operating amperages of magneto resistive heads on the stationary drum side and a decoder circuit, a current supply circuit for supplying operating currents to the magneto resistive heads in response to the output signals of the decoder circuit on the rotary drum side.

This is achieved by providing a recording/reproducing unit for recording/reproducing signals onto/from a recording medium with plural heads, a generating unit for generating control data for controlling the recording/reproducing unit, and a transmitting unit for transmitting control data generated by the generating unit to the recording/reproducing unit, wherein data for controlling the switching over among the plurality of heads are transmitted with priority over other control data.

* The invention is a system and method for locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, with improved accuracy in the presence of adjacent objects.
* The system includes a transmitter with a pair of antennae that induce distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and a receiver that senses magnetic fields associated with the currents and produces an output signal dependent upon both fields.
* The method involves producing distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, moving a receiver sensitive to the magnetic fields, and producing an output signal from the receiver dependent upon both fields.
* The transmitter and receiver are designed to optimize the inducement of currents in the respective objects and the sensing of magnetic fields, and to reduce interference from other objects.
* The system can produce distinct output signal nulls over the respective objects, facilitating their location and tracing.
* The invention is particularly useful in environments where the horizontal separation between the objects is related to their depth, and the field from the transmitter decreases rapidly with distance.
</summary>

- The invention describes a two-part cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices. The first part is an attachment member that is installed over a wiring device and mounted to it using available fasteners. The second part is a cover plate member that has no fastener holes and latches onto the attachment member. The cover plate member can be easily removed using a small tool inserted into a slot in its bottom end wall. The invention allows for quick and easy installation and removal of the cover plate device, accommodates variations in wall flatness or evenness, and provides a finished look without exposed fasteners.

The number of racks, pawls, tabs, and slots in the attachment plate and cover plate varies depending on the number of wiring devices being covered. For an even number of wiring devices, there will be an odd number of racks and pawls, and an even number of tabs and slots. For an odd number of wiring devices, there will be an even number of pawls, racks, tabs, and slots.

* The present invention describes a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, which consists of a number of annular strips that are concentrically nested and can slide over one another between a pushed-in position and a pushed-out position. This design allows the device to be folded around the displaying screen, taking up little space when collapsed and providing the ability to view the screen from different angles.
 * The device is attached to the monitor using a flange and an adapter member, which can compensate for any curvature of the monitor's front and provide a flat attachment face. The adapter member has a recess filled with compressible material, allowing it to be attached to the monitor in an attractive manner without forming large gaps. The annular strips have hooks and locking projections that prevent the device from separating into its component parts and ensure reliable folding-in and folding-out.

* The invention relates to automatically providing an indication to a speaker when their rate of speech is likely to be greater than a rate that a listener is able to comprehend.
* The system includes a device that monitors the rate of speech during a discourse and provides an indicator warning the speaker to slow down when the speaking rate exceeds the listening rate.
* The device can be a wearable device, such as a smart phone, that can vibrate, blink, produce speech, and/or provide another indicator that notifies the speaker to decrease their speaking rate.
* The device includes a microphone, a sensory mechanism, a speaking rate processor, a language detector, a speech clarity processor, a comprehension comparator, and a wireless transceiver.
* The method for automatically notifying a speaker to decrease their speaking rate includes identifying a discourse involving a speaker and one or more listeners, detecting a language being spoken, determining a speaking threshold, and notifying the speaker to reduce their speaking rate when the speaking rate exceeds the speaking threshold.

</summary>

Explanation:

* The invention is about a system and method for automatically providing an indication to a speaker when their rate of speech is likely to be greater than a rate that a listener is able to comprehend.
* The system includes a device that monitors the rate of speech during a discourse and provides an indicator warning the speaker to slow down when the speaking rate exceeds the listening rate. The device can be a wearable device, such as a smart phone, that can notify the speaker through vibration, blinking, speech, or other means.
* The device includes various components such as a microphone, a sensory mechanism, a speaking rate processor, a language detector, a speech clarity processor, a comprehension comparator, and a wireless transceiver.
* The method for automatically notifying a speaker to decrease their speaking rate includes identifying a discourse involving a speaker and one or more listeners, detecting a language being spoken, determining a speaking threshold based on the listener's proficiency, and notifying the speaker to reduce their speaking rate when the speaking rate exceeds the speaking threshold.
* The system and method can be implemented in hardware, software, or a combination of both, and can be centralized or distributed across several interconnected computer systems.

<summary>

- The invention describes a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which increases the picture sequence frequency to obtain higher resolution in time.
- The device includes means for deviating and suppressing the beam, a cyclic line counter, a sawtooth generator, and a delay device.
- The line counter and sawtooth generator are controlled via the delay device, which is triggered by the output of the counter.
- The device can increase the picture sequence frequency by scanning over a selectable number of lines (N) and suppressing the beam during line and picture change periods.
</summary>

The invention relates to a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera. The device aims to obtain a higher picture sequence frequency to permit TV recordings of rapid processes with high and selectable resolution in time. The device comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam, a cyclic line counter, a sawtooth generator, and a delay device. The line counter and sawtooth generator are controlled via the delay device, which is triggered by the output of the counter. The device can increase the picture sequence frequency by scanning over a selectable number of lines (N) and suppressing the beam during line and picture change periods. This allows for the recording of rapid processes with high resolution in time, making it possible to analyze processes that previously required expensive film cameras with rotating mirrors. The device can also be used for recording IR, UV, or X-ray pictures.

<summary>
	• The invention aims to enable multimedia capabilities while using existing network devices and customer premises equipment.
	• A blended call is created by sending calls to blender software, which initiates parallel voice and multimedia components with the customer premises equipment.
	• The blender software keeps control of the signaling paths of the parallel components to accommodate multimedia requests at any stage during the call.
	• The communication environment includes a SIP-enabled network with telephony servers, database servers, and multimedia servers.
	• The blender software is associated with the telephony server and manages blended calls using the functions of the multimedia server and telephony server.
	• The blender software receives the call request and initiates a single session with two call components: a voice call component and a multimedia call component.
	• The voice call component is handled through the telephony server, and the multimedia call component is handled through the multimedia server.
	</summary>

1. The present invention describes a content synchronization framework for connected devices that allows for contextual synchronization over various communication network topologies. The framework is highly scalable, supports multiple languages and character sets, and enables a client device to have the latest and most relevant content at all times.
2. The synchronization process involves sharing contextual information or dynamic attributes from the client device with the central reference point, which then compiles bundle information based on the dynamic attribute information provided. The central reference point composes a response made up of zero or more bundles, with the bundle files listed in an order of priority for the client device.
3. The client device composes a delta list of all the files in the bundle that are different from local copies available to the client device. The client then retrieves the files in the ordered delta list from various servers indicated in the bundles, such as the central reference point, download servers and external partners.
4. Each bundle contains a set of properties that directs the client device in understanding the content and properties of files named in the bundle. Bundle properties tell the client device locations of files in the bundle, list download priorities for files, and inform the client device of actions that need to be performed on the bundle after it has been downloaded. File descriptions also have properties that help the client determine if the subject file is new and aid in processing the file.

* The present invention is a system and method for allowing a person who finds a lost or misplaced object to anonymously communicate with the object's owner to facilitate its return.
* The system includes specially prepared tags with a unique ID and a reference to a specific website or other virtual locale, which are affixed to portable possessions.
* Owners register the tag IDs and their contact information on a centralized and network accessible database.
* Finders can access the website or virtual locale referenced on the tag to communicate with the owner and arrange for the return of the object.
* The system maintains the anonymity of both the owner and the finder, and can be used to return a wide variety of lost or misplaced items.
* The invention can be implemented using various programming languages, operating systems, and database systems.
</summary>

The present invention is a system and method for allowing a person who finds a lost or misplaced object to anonymously communicate with the object's owner to facilitate its return. • The invention was made with government support and the government has certain rights in the invention.
• The invention is related to electron multipliers used in photomultipliers and particle detectors, specifically channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates.
• There are two types of conventional electron multipliers: discrete dynode multipliers and continuous electron multipliers.
• Discrete dynode multipliers consist of dynode stages that initiate and amplify a cascade of electrons, with each stage biased at a high negative voltage relative to the anode.
• The gain of a discrete dynode multiplier is given by the equation G D =γ I γ SE N−1, where γ SE is the average number of secondary electrons emitted by an electron from one dynode impacting on the next sequential dynode and N is the number of dynodes used in the detector.
• Continuous electron multipliers, such as channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates, employ one or more high resistivity glass channels or tubes, each of which acts as a series of continuous dynodes.
• The gain of a continuous electron multiplier can be modeled as a series of discrete dynodes and is also given by the equation G D =γ I γ SE N−1.
• The foil electron multiplier, in accordance with the present invention, encompasses a next generation design of electron multipliers that uses a sequential series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons in a series of transmission stages.
• The gain of a foil electron multiplier is maximized by maximizing the electron transmission through the foil, maximizing the transmission through the support grid, and maximizing the secondary electron emission yield of the foil material.
• The gain advantage of the foil electron multiplier over conventional multipliers lies in the term γ SE +1, which represents the secondary electron yield from a primary electron exiting a foil and the continuation of the primary electron with the secondaries that it produces.

1. The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a system that allows for the viewing of 3-dimensional effects in motion pictures using ordinary film or digital technology.
2. The system utilizes glasses with individually controllable lenses and a digital sensor to capture and process the motion picture frames.
3. The processing algorithm identifies synchronization events in the motion picture and controls the state of the lenses accordingly.
4. The lenses can take three different states: clear-clear, clear-darkened, and darkened-clear.
5. The glasses look like ordinary lightweight glasses and can be used with various viewing media.
6. The system does not require any special equipment for filming or projection.
7. The battery-powered viewer glasses are controlled in real-time by an intelligent processor packaged with the glasses.
8. The 3-D effect is only activated when sustained lateral motion is detected, reducing eyestrain and discomfort.
9. The system can be extended to other visual effects and algorithms for detecting motion in motion pictures.

<summary>

- The invention describes a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate the individual die from the wafer without a wafer saw. The process involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer and then applying mechanical pressure to the wafer to singulate the individual die.
- The method includes applying a photo resist layer on the wafer surface, patterning it to form openings over the scribe lines, and then etching the wafer through the openings to form trenches along the scribe lines. The depth of the trenches may vary and can be adjusted based on the final thickness of the wafer required for the application.
- After etching, an adhesive tape is applied to the back-surface of the wafer, and mechanical pressure is applied to the back surface of the wafer to cause a "clean break" along the trenches, thereby singulating the dice from the wafer. The pressure can be applied in the X and Y directions or in a circular motion around the wafer.
</summary>

The invention describes a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate the individual die from the wafer without a wafer saw. The process involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer and then applying mechanical pressure to the wafer to singulate the individual die.

The method includes applying a photo resist layer on the wafer surface, patterning it to form openings over the scribe lines, and then etching the wafer through the openings to form trenches along the scribe lines. The depth of the trenches may vary and can be adjusted based on the final thickness of the wafer required for the application.

After etching, an adhesive tape is applied to the back-surface of the wafer, and mechanical pressure is applied to the back surface of the wafer to cause a "clean break" along the trenches, thereby singulating the dice from the wafer. The pressure can be applied in the X and Y directions or in a circular motion around the wafer.

<summary>

* The text describes a field emission display (FED) device that includes a cathode, an anode, and field emission elements (FED elements) that emit high-energy electrons towards the anode.
* An operating voltage source is used to establish an electric field between the cathode and anode, causing the FED elements to emit electrons.
* A protection structure is also described, which includes at least one reduction plate or electrode that is provided on the cathode and has a negative charge.
* The reduction plate attracts positive nitrogen and oxygen ions formed by the high-energy electrons emitted by the FED elements, preventing the ions from contacting the cathode and inducing surging of an excessive electrical current.
* The protection structure can be implemented in various ways, such as elongated and parallel reduction plates that are adjacent to the FED elements, or a meshwork-shaped or net-shaped configuration of reduction plates.
* The FED device with the protection structure prolongs the lifetime of the device by preventing surges in electrical current from being drawn to the cathode and inducing burnout damage to the FED elements.

</summary>

* The present invention is an image sensor with multiple imaging planes, including a top imaging plane and imaging planes on two edge surfaces.
* The sensor includes a P-type substrate with a highly doped bottom layer and an upper layer having a high carrier lifetime.
* Image sensor elements are formed in the upper layer and include an image sensing region and a charge collecting and transfer means.
* A P+ layer is formed between each edge surface and the column of image sensor elements adjacent to the edge surface, creating a barrier to electron movement and guiding charge carriers back toward the middle of the substrate.
* The thickness of the upper layer determines the effective vertical aperture dimension in the edge surfaces of the sensor.
* The charge collecting and transfer means is a buried-channel CCD formed by an N-type region.
* The sensor can image in a plurality of planes, allowing for the simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces or the surface imaging of passageways.
* The sensor can be easily incorporated in various types of known image sensors as it uses processing techniques compatible with other image sensors.
* The sensor can be used for color applications, with different color filters placed over the image sensor elements in different imaging planes.

<summary>

* The text describes a system and method for managing power consumption in a home network by transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device.
* The network includes various devices capable of performing specific nominal functions and communicating with each other via a network medium.
* The network is implemented as a master/slave network, with one device serving as the network master node and all other devices serving as network slave nodes.
* The network master node performs network administrative functions, such as beacon transmission, device association and authentication, admission control, and bandwidth assignment.
* The network slave nodes can be promoted to the network master role if the current master node enters a power management state.
* The system ensures that only the best qualified of available network slave nodes is promoted to the network master role, thereby maximizing the performance and administration of the home network.
* The system minimizes the total power consumption of the home network while ensuring that the administrative functions of the network are performed by another device.

</summary>

Note: The above summary is a general overview of the text and may not include all the details and nuances of the original text. It is recommended to read the full text for a complete understanding.

1. The invention is related to an antenna array for measuring the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation using radio interferometric techniques. The array consists of at least four antennae arranged in at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane, with each triplet having a specific spacing of elements and height of the center element above the ground plane. The array can operate in both receive and transmit modes.
2. The antenna array uses vectorial combination of information signals obtained from the outermost antennae of each triplet to derive a first signal, and the modulus of the information signal from the center antenna to derive a second signal. The second signal is then divided by the first signal to provide a quotient signal for each triplet, which is a function of the elevation angle but not of the ground reflection coefficient.
3. The array can be used for unambiguous angle measurement in the receive mode, or for determining the range, identity, and elevation angle of an aircraft carrying a suitable transponder in the transmit mode. The array can also be used for coding angles in space by energizing specific triplets with a coherent carrier and deriving quotients of modulation sidebands in a remote receiver.

<summary>

- The text describes a new design for a subminiature lamp assembly that aims to solve problems associated with conventional subminiature lamps, such as the use of adhesives that break down over time, the use of materials with different thermal expansion coefficients, and the degradation of adhesives due to cleaning and sterilization procedures. The proposed solution involves the use of a high-temperature polymer that surrounds and is in compression contact with the glass envelope, providing extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack.
- The text also discusses the importance of minimizing the number of sealing points and maximizing the length of a seal surface in subminiature lamps, as well as the use of a pourable potting material to backfill the cavity within the abbreviated height one piece conductive base and form a barrier for gasses to penetrate into the hot subminiature lamp end.

</summary>

<summary>
• The document describes a technique for realizing a GDFE Precoder for multi-user MIMO systems, which significantly reduces the computational cost while resulting in no capacity loss.
• The technique relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix (S zz ) corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise," which is a key component in conventional design of a GDFE Precoder and requires extensive computational cost.
• The described implementation of a GDFE Precoder does not require channel reduction when the Input Covariance Matrix (S xx ) for downlink channel is rank deficient.
• The technique achieves significant improvement in computational cost over conventional GDFE Precoders.
• The invention also describes a method for configuring a GDFE Precoder in a base station of a MU-MIMO wireless system having k user terminals (UTs), each user terminal having associated therewith a feedforward filter.
• The method computes a filter matrix C using one of a plurality of alternative formulas, and based on the computation of the filter matrix C, computes a transmit filter matrix B for a transmit filter used to process a symbol vector obtained after a decision feedback equalizing stage of the GDFE precoder, computes the feedforward filter matrix F, and computes the interference pre-cancellation matrix G.
</summary>
